One thing that you wanna be aware of before coming in is the smell of the pond/lake right next to this place, which is pretty bad and you can still smell it while eating at this place, so if you are smell sensitive, you probably wanna avoid here. As for the food, I liked the braised mushrooms especially.

A great restaurant tucked away just off a main road. The owners used to run a restaurant in HCMC, and it shows in the level of quality, which is clearly a cut above the average in Vung Tau.

We had the fresh springrolls, rice vermicelli soup, lemongrass chili tofu and the delightful lime and mushroom salad, which was probably my favorite.

I recommend anyone, vegetarian, vegan or otherwise to give this place a try!

I used Grab delivery several times for veggie food from this place while staying in Vung Tau. Very decent portions, tasty and delicious food. I recommend raw veggie spring rolls ðŸ’š Was pleased to try out mushrooms served along with most of the dishes. Thank you ðŸ™ðŸ» Com on ðŸ«¶
A Vung Tau Institution never a bad meal here always consistent with the food and service. First time back in a couple of years, we had a great lunch and a relaxing time, bumping into old friends!

Excellent food and service. I come here a lot and always feel very welcome. The menu has a wide selection of food and the portions are large. I usually go for the Belly burger or chicken parmigiana which are both top notch. Great grub no matter what time of the day or night it is and the eatery is usually my go to spot for comfort food! (Especially when hung over)

Happy Birthday, Belly! What a milestoneâ€”57 years of bringing that unbeatable hospitality to the beachfront scene since you were just a wide-eyed 13-year-old back in '68. I can only imagine the stories from those early days: sandy toes, endless waves, and you already gearing up to be the guy who'd hand over his (admittedly threadbare) shirt to a stranger in need. Meeting you in 2006 sounds like the stuff of legendâ€”welcoming folks from every corner of the map, dishing out the absolute best grub under the sun, and turning every gathering into a memory that sticks. Here's to you growing old with that same fire: never dimming, always sharing the laughs, the feasts, and the open-hearted vibe that makes life richer. Cheers to many more beachfront sunsetsâ€”may they all come with extra helpings of whatever magic you've got cooking! ðŸŽ‰ðŸ¥³

Nice place for western cuisine, though the servers don't speak much English which made communication a bit complicated.

Hot and fresh food, pizza was freshly oven baked and tasty. The grilled sea bream was well made and the pepper sauce was so good we asked for extra!

Decent vegetarian options too and of course plenty of cold beer ðŸº
Amazing food and drinks, diverse menu, friendly staff and great atmosphere. Would recommend.

The owner needs to take note. I was in here for lunch and this place was doing the card 4 beers for 100,000 the same as all the other bars. That night it was suddenly 140,000 with staff telling me it has been that way for a while (lies). The menu had the beer for 30,000 and they then tried to charge 35,000. That is false advertising. You are charging way over and trying to scam people. Is the owner who I met today aware this is going on or are the staff cheating people and pocketing the difference? Interested to here back from the owner.

Tasty dishes with huge amount
Spacious and friendly atmosphere
Large parking lot
Friendly staff
Highly rcm

Good solid expatriate comfort food here. I had the pork with mustard sauce (eh), Giang had the barbecue pork ribs (ah). Giang ordered better than I did. Anyway, they were both good plates of food for a reasonable price. So this looks like the main Australian expatriate hang-out bar of Vung Tao possibly all of Vietnam. Seems like a lot of old timers come together here to pass the time they got left. It also looks like the bar runs tours to Long Tan Cemetery and the battlefields where the Australians fought during the Vietnam / American War. Probably this is the best place where you can learn about Australia's participation and their soldiers' bravery in that war. I don't get it though how some people are defined or find identity by their military service. I'm retired from the American Army.  I don't know, sometimes I feel like I was never in the Army and those decades never happened.

Went here by recommendation.
Ambience was OK
Fries was okay
The fish in fish and chips was terrible.
The steak pie was probably chicken and the consistency more like soup. Microwaved directly from the freezer perhaps?
The full English. Hash browns was okay restâ€¦not so.
Still the worst was the waitress that was disgusting. Keeping on spitting out things from her mouth and putting on any tables ashtray when taking our parser and serving us.

Dropped in on a recommendation from a friend. We walked in the front. Every one starts yelling hello, hey mate ðŸ˜ƒ. The patrons picked us as Aussies straight away. We were greeted very warmly, served quickly and our Aussie burger and chips were great
Belly (the owner) sat with us for awhile other patrons shouted us drinks. This is an Aussie/ kiwi veteran hangout. We were made to feel right at home
Belly made phone calls to other veterans to organise a tour of the tunnels for us
Definitely a must pop in for a drink type of place especially if you're Aussie or Kiwi

Very very good restaurant! Food is so tasty and delicious. Many offerings from western dishes to Vietnamese dishes. Prices are fair. Portions are generous. Loved the salmon. Cold refreshing drinks. Good place to hangout and relax while enjoying food. Would recommend. Nice scenery and good background music.
This is where you can grab some snacks a couple of beers for a lovely evening especially football time. For those who want tasty meals this is absolutely recommended

Menu was extensive with a lot of good options! The food was delicious & service was quick! Very laid back space, I really enjoyed it! Pictured is the chicken parmesan with fries and rice and bbq pork ribs with fries and rice! The ribs were SO GOOD! Fall off the bone and tender. Would 10/10 recommend.
Offers a range of western and Vietnamese food. Also beer packages. Tasty meal too

Long established institution here at Vung Tau. The eatery is named after the larger than life character Belly who mingles with the crowds who throngs here.

Hail fellow well met is the ambience here

Belly's Watering Hole was established more than 15 years ago along the Front Beach & moved here to the Aussie enclave about 10 years ago.

Do try the Big Breakfast at VND 150,000 a pop ( circa USD 7.00 ) . Egg Benedict would be another good suggestion. Roast Beef & other savoury fares are served during the weekends

We always go for cold,cold beers and great food when visiting Vung Tau. A friendly, mainly expat, clientele just chilling or watching sports on the big TV. The food is really good with generous servings at reasonable prices. The grilled chicken with mushroom parmesan sauce excellent, as was the grilled bass with pepper sauce. A good red wine also reasonable prices.

I love this place and frequent it often.  I just had the grilled salmon with a white wine sauce and it was absolutely fantastic.  I have to eat gluten free food and their menu has enough selections to allow me to do that.
Great place to visit if you're looking for some expat company. Belly is a great host that supports local community.

My omelette was very good. A breakfast that really filled me and made me ready for the day.
Enough seats available also for bigger groups.
Service was polite and fast.

A great place for good food and drink
Buy a bar ticket for100vnd for 5 beers which you can redeem today tomorrow or next week/month

Definitely OPEN for business as of today: 17-01-2020. Always great food served in substantial portions. Friendly and attractive waitresses. Belly is a very nice guy. Lots of charitable functions here, focusing on the needs of local orphans. Tip jar at the bar when you are leaving. Cheers!
Great food and drinks and atmosphere here. I think this place is a hidden gem for any travelers looking for something different. Thank You Mr Belly and your staff for the great experience.

Great Service. Excellent food. I had the American Burger. It was by far the biggest burger I've had since being in Vietnam. Nice fresh bun with cheese, lettuce, tomato,  and pickles. I got onions added. The fries were hot and fresh tasty, not greasy.

6am opening allows for a pirates start on drinking. Friendly ambience, great staff, good service and excellent food, anything from steak pies through to Viet cuisine. Walking distance to many other bars.

Excellent place to go for food and the ice cold beer is cheap!
Staff were super friendly
Food is good, and nice feel to the place. Staff were a little slow at realising I wanted to add to my order (waited 10 minutes) but were very apologetic and gave me a free coke.
Great place with excellent food and drinks. Lots of Australian customers so always someone to chat with if you speak English. The staff is super friendly.
SuperðŸ‘Œ. Top quality food and serving size. Staff are great. Nice ambience with Aussie sport.
Food was good Excellent!! I enjoyed it. Staff friendly and good at English spoke. But we couldn't find WiFi there. Just have been there first time maybe can try 1 more some day.
Good food. All the aussie games live. Bellyâ€™s a nice guy too. Ripper Aussie bar

Had Chicken Gordon Blue and Sweet and sour pork
Food was excellent
Huge variety
A definite must visit
Food is really delicious. I love food here. I don't like decoration much but it's good enough to enjoy a nice meal. I'll go back here soon.
I love to Come here, good food, nice people,, everything go fast, super place ðŸ˜ŠðŸ‘

What a great bunch of people that run and work here. I found myself eating and drinking here daily.
The atmosphere here was relaxing and friendly with good music a pool table to your left as you walk in.
The place is also supporting under privileged children with Christmas present and food for the village's â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸

I have been here a couple of times and the service is very good and the staff is very friendly. It's a little on the pricy side but definitely worth it once in a while. The food is great. The lamb chops is definitely worth a try.

Food always good in large serving
Has Chicken schnitzel here x3 times while staying in Vung Tau
The establishment supports local schools and orphanages , was a pleasure to support them
Recommend a visit when in Vung Tau

Great atmosphere. Great food.
Lots of expats
It is one of our favourite place in VT now, we had delicious ham and cheese crossiants and they have English books too, we just brought a few back home to read for free, thank you so much.
Ate here a few times. Was always good food and good staff
Been coming to Bellys for many years and have always felt at home great food and company

Background music was awful but staff did not change.
Western style food and all western customers if you like that sort of thingâ€¦ makes me wonder why people travel
The staff are incredibly friendly and the food is good. There are many options in the area, but this place seems like the perfect choice. I have been twice, and if time allows, I will return again.
I have to rave about the coffee here. My go to place in the morning for a coffee now.  My morning latte is always an absolute delight!!
Really amazing burgers!! First time at Bellyâ€™s and wasnâ€™t disappointed â¤ï¸ definitely will be back!

Food is good.
They have Roast on Sunday and very tasty!
Recommended by another X pat for tours etc we were not disappointed. Good, beer etc was all above average
Really nice sunday lunch. Staff are attentive and really nice. Food was delicious.
Great place, good food, cold beer, friendly staffs

Dropped in to watch All Blacks vs Wallabies test match that kicked off at 0930hrs local time. Friendly owner & staff. Had the Big Breakfast and a couple of beers. Good value and good atmosphere. Good natured banter between the Kiwi and Aussie fans. Would definitely go back.

We would typically drop by in the evening to have a few beers and chats. The place is not too crowded with some quiet background music(western).
The lamb chops are decent especially when they're drowned in thick gravy that I like!

Fantastic place for expats, great selection of food, good drinks and the staff are friendly and welcoming.
A must to visit when you gi to Vung Tau.
Nice pub, cold beer and friendly staff. One of the better burgers I've had in Vung Tau.
Being going to Bellys now over the 9 years I have been visiting a great meeting place  food is good value for money and all sports are shown not just the AFL which is plus
Many choices on menu and all meet expectations. Also good service.

Great place to relax and have a beer. I have had many meals at belly's, and would have to say it's probably best western food in vung tau.  And the Vietnamese dishes are great too. The staff are great , service is spot on! And so many laughs to be had! I always miss this place when I'm not in Vietnam.

Come here every time I visit Vung Tau. Extensive menu with Western dishes and good Vietnamese food too. Plenty of choice for breakfast, lunch and dinner that won't break the bank. Any dish that includes gravy is to die for. Relaxed atmosphere and nice staff. Lots of drinks including cheap beer.

First impressions of Belly's was that it looked like a fairly basic, no frills place.
However, what wasn't basic was the food, or the service.
Would have to say it was the best meal I had in Vung Tau, steak tender and cooked to perfection, and you just have to try the Apple pie with ice cream!
The staff were jovial and friendly and actually looked like they enjoyed interaction with the customers. Big tick from us
Loved the atmosphere.  Good cold beer. Great smoothies and staff so friendly. And we could watch rugby league there.

Great value for money at this establishment. Love the All Blacks memorabilia ðŸ˜„

I had a beer and we enjoyed our meals, even my picky 14yo teenager. This place is low key chill, defo recommend this. â­â­â­â­
Good food great atmosphere expats and vets all feel welcome bar and reataurant veterans

Quite good dishes. A roomy place. Very friendly and attentive waitresses.
The front part of the place had some British people, watching a football match (rugby) with a pint of beer. Sadly, like the British often do abroad, clad in a singlet and cheap shorts. We preferred to have our dinner in the back part, more "restaurant" like.

The food is fresh, delicious and varied. One of the rare places where you can find pie and gravy, full English, full American breakfast and Vietnamese food. The portions are copious and the ladies are all welcoming, mastering their English skills too. This is the place where you can also rent scooters

Stopped in for a couple beers and fries.  One waitress was super nice and I joked with her.  Her shift ended at 3pm and she left. The other 4 girls were ice cold. When I tried to use Google translate to get Bill they were dismissive and could not care less about customer service.  I won't come back here.

Where to start... First of all, the 3 waitress ladies are amazing, can not lie about that. The only problem are the expats who are there everyday and think they own the bar. If you're not an Aussie, stay away. Also as a solo female traveller, it's really not a comfortable feeling to be there between only old men who starts being annoying after a bunch of beers. I tried going there 3 times in the hope to meet some younger people, unfortunately, always the same old men. About the food, it's not bad at all but if you want to join your food, 'hide' inside instead of outside where all the drunk expats are.

Found out about this place at the last minute, wish we had found it sooner. Fab choice of food. Belly was very informative on suggestions if where to go in Vietnam. We took his advice and went to Phu Quoc, so glad we did. He arranged for transport to the airport. A must place to visit if you are craving food from home. ðŸ‘ðŸ‘
Great food and big portions.

The best place for a meal and a chat with excellent food and staff that are just amazing.... also the owner (belly) is there every day and makes you feel so welcome and special like hes known you for years.... if i could give 10 stars i would, do yourself a favour and drop in for a feed or a beer/beers and experience the best hospitality in vietnam

Open space with plenty of seating including a pool table and a cool big screen TV for viewing music videos, sports, etc. Service was very attentive (which is a surprise in Vietnam) beer was nice and cold, daily menu specials available and food was above par. Cool place to have some cold brews, western and seafood and to enjoy a chill environment.
This is the best food in Vietnam and the service is A1. Belly the owner is a legend and well worth having a beer with. Cheers everyone , see you next time ðŸ‘ðŸ½
After 2 weeks travelling in Vietnam...great to come back to a great Aussie owner and staff
Love the place. Look for the owner with a tea towel on his shoulder and a bald head with a lawn mower tattoo. A real gentleman.
I was happy with the burger quality and I will be back; in my opinion the owner should find a solution to reduce the high temperature at noon time and the staff should be more attentive to customers.
The one and only original. A great place any day and anytime. Breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Thanks, Belly, everyone!
The food is good as long as you order there special. The food on the menu is a hot or miss, the service is good , tried the shintzel and lamb and salmon , the salmon was dry , but the rest was nice

My wife and I often order food from this restaurant. Always very delicious, and large portions for the price. When getting delivery the staff are always very fast and have plenty of change. When ordering in the restaurant the staff are always very friendly and attentive. Excellent Restaurant!

One of few places in Vung Tau with nice reviews, which I decided to visit. Huge menu, with lots of options. Not for 5stars, but best you can get around. Most of visitors are not from here, feeling of the expat bar.
Service was great. As was the food. Beer inexpensive and finally it's an Aussie hangout. What's not to love. Oh, they also rent bikes.
Been here a couple of times now, and the food was so good every time. The staff is really nice!
Great place to watch Australian sports and international. Food ok service good beer cold and you can buy beer tickets that make the beer even cheaper
Nice friendly atmosphere and nice western dashes on the menu.

Bellys Restaurant is a fantastic venue for breakfast lunch or dinner, the atmosphere is so friendly and inviting. The choice of food is varied, from western to eastern cultures ( I never had a meal served i was unhappy with ) they also so wifi and foxtell, so you never miss your staying in contact with others or your sports. An added bonus is you can  hire scooters from the bar ðŸ˜„, and the owner is an avid historian of the area and tour guide

Went to Belly's late afternoon for a few beers and a feed. Agree with all comments, that atmosphere was great, as was service. My problem is I ordered a pizza, and within a few hours (and all night, and into the next day!) I had violent food poisoning! Not sure if it was the prawns on the pizza, but the end result has not been pretty!!

I have been going to Bellys for many years and recomended to many people but has gone down hill food wise.
The Atmosphere is still great service excellent but food is overpriced and not very good. Dishes are short on ingrediants eg. Hamburger good meat but very very little tomato onion and lettuce chips not cooked.. Pizza all cheese very little of anything else.
Sorry Belly just saying what many others are saying also.

Arrived just as they were closing, but the staff looked at my sad starving puppy dog eyes and let me order take away. (Really though I also had my puppy with me and they donâ€™t allow dogs) They were super kind and let me order a piece of pie with ice cream. Just hit the spot. Thank you for rescuing me.

Belly serves his Kiwi mother's recipe for savoury mince on toast with two runny poached eggs on top.
We just spent 4 nights in Vung Tau and we ate it 4 times. Once for brunch. Twice for lunch and once for dinner at night. Comfort food has that sort of magnetic attraction. Lol.
No photos to show as we tucked into it the moment our plates hit the table. Lol.
Very good Vietnamese and international dishes!

If it's Sunday lunchtime and you are hungry and missing your favorite sporting match then this is the place for you. Great Sunday lunch box screen sports and cold cold drinks makes it a no excellent watering hole for a summer day in Vung Tau

Expat bar.  Many long term regulars who keep to themselves , but don't let that put you off.  Good selection in the menu and drink prices are good.
Sport on the TV.
Food is good, especially roast dinners, portions are big, filled up. Good service, separated bills if you are in good and want to. Service is fast. Price is surprisingly cheap.
Been many restruants in Vietnam, Bellys never fails in price, food quality and atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit.
Best lamb roast in many years, even a Yorkshire pudding, definitely get the beer ticket and enjoy a great bar
Great place to eat n drink also talk to Belly about a Long Tan, Nui Dat tour an experience you'll never forget
Great western food and very friendly service
Made to feel very welcome waiters can speak pretty good English food is good large servings kids are looked after very well priced

First time visit to Vietnam and this place is a gem !!!
Love Belly and the help of Warren to do the long tan tour .
You would be silly not to stop in !

As the name suggests you can get a coldie here and a good meal; if you're expat Ozzie you can even get a "Vegemite sandwhich" along with a hearty welcome.
And on special occasions you can get entertainment and special meal deals. Belly's is an ideal place for larger group meetings or just a social drop-in to watch sports.
Awesome food ,really nice relaxed people. , if your looking for good steak in vietnam  I would start there.. lamb shanks and spring rolls were beautiful also.

Sat in the bar and ordered Chicken and Chips takeaway and a beer gave up on it 75 mins later when food arrived for a couple sat opposite me who came in 30 mins later than me. Asked for my bill and still tried to charge me for it. What can I say! I understand that he bar was busy because of tet but is that an excuse! I certainly will not come back. Best check my fridge now to see if I can scrape a feed together.
I had a beer and watched  a rugby league game. Friendly staff and patrons and the owner introduced himself which was nice.
Great place for a beer ,food,and a chat  owner is a champ
Ideal if you fancy a bit of western cuisine served by friendly staff. Appears to be an expat haunt and most of the expats appear to be Aussie, although I'm ex UK.

Incredible ! Amazing ! We were surprised by really tasty , miamy meals, beautiful food and quality services :) :) . Excellent ! 5 big stars from  traveller's choice ! Unforgettable souvenirs !........ thank you !!!!
Best breakfast place in Vungtau ðŸ‘ŒðŸ»

We were at Belly for breakfast this morning. Our boy plays with toys that belong to Belly around the top of the pool table with light platic car. The table was covered for protection.  A man and remove toys from the table with behavior that is not acceptable to a small boy.  We will not be back to this again.  It is regrettable that someone has such behavior and cannot speak in a more polite manner in font a little boy.
A great Aussie theme bistro bar .   Excellent food and good value.

Best chicken pho with fresh chilliâ€™s  in Vung Tau
Highly recommend for Breakfast
A great expat place great prices I ordered the lamb and it was to die for fall apart
I would say the best food you can get in vungtau. Worth the quality and quantity for the price. Definitely a come back place.
I have eaten here a few times, it's also good if you just want a beer. It's always good.

Atrocious service with a very arrogant attitude from waiters and some discriminatory argument and treatment when not Australian or English-Speaking Natives. Should better train their waiters. Non-Australian, please avoid.
Good food and service was great. A great neighborhood bar
Yummy Steakpie with mashed potatoes, gravy and peas. Cold beer, fresh coconut . Great place for some western food.
We had dinner the last night we were in Vung Tau, wish we would have found it sooner. Really good food at a decent price.
Nice food, nice staff
Higly recommend. Good food, very much to choose. Just little bit expensive
4 of us had dinner there & it was great, 2x Lamb Shanks, 1 Lamb rack & 1 pie.
Great big plates of food at very cheap price. Lovely service.
Breakfast this morning. Seafood fried rice and fresh coconut juice. Always an enjoyable meal. No fancy stuff just good taste tucker. Good staff.
I should have trusted my nose. The lemon butter sauce on the fish smelled off but I ate it anyway, maybe rancid butter. Now I have a bad belly. Thanks Belly's for ruining my holiday!
Consistently good food! One of my favourite spots to go for seabass for lunch! You can get a dandy roast on Sundays as well!
A Vung Tau Institution never a bad meal here always consistent with the food and service. First time back in a couple of years, we had a great lunch and a relaxing time, bumping into old friends!

Excellent food and service. I come here a lot and always feel very welcome. The menu has a wide selection of food and the portions are large. I usually go for the Belly burger or chicken parmigiana which are both top notch. Great grub no matter what time of the day or night it is and the eatery is usually my go to spot for comfort food! (Especially when hung over)

Nice place for western cuisine, though the servers don't speak much English which made communication a bit complicated.

Hot and fresh food, pizza was freshly oven baked and tasty. The grilled sea bream was well made and the pepper sauce was so good we asked for extra!

Decent vegetarian options too and of course plenty of cold beer ðŸº
Amazing food and drinks, diverse menu, friendly staff and great atmosphere. Would recommend.

The owner needs to take note. I was in here for lunch and this place was doing the card 4 beers for 100,000 the same as all the other bars. Interested to here back from the owner.

Tasty dishes with huge amount
Spacious and friendly atmosphere
Large parking lot
Friendly staff
Highly rcm

Order was clear but when my plate is served. Presentation is great! The size of my beef steak is not up to 200g. Felt cheated and I ask for medium well, almost half of it was black and dry, over grilled! taste very blend. I do enjoy the salad cuz is fresh! I dont see any special about the skills of the chefs here! Price is reasonable! Maybe I will order something like sashimi next time cuz it just have to be fresh and no skills needed!

The food here is absolutely delicious! Every dish we tried was bursting with flavor and cooked to perfection. I highly recommend the crab spaghetti . The presentation was beautiful, too â€“ each plate looked like a work of art."

Amazing food and service! The meat is perfectly cooked and the sushi is also amazing.

Price is also good for the portions you receive. Definitely a must go if you visit Vung Tau!
BEST SUSHI IN VUNG TAU Amazing food and presentation. Exceptional service. Everything was cooked well.    egg salad,  eel roll, rib eye salmon roll/ beef roll  my face says it all.
The place had a great atmosphere and was very clean. The staff were incredibly friendly. The steak was perfectly cookedâ€”tender and full of flavor. The salad was fresh and crisp.

unbelievable that in Vung Tau has this amazing restaurant. Their steaks are perfecly cooked, the sauces, potatoes and salads are fresh and well seasoning. My son loves the spagetti here.

Plus point for this restaurant: They are kids friendly, they have high chair, dining set for kids and a scissor to chop food for kids.

The atmosphere are quiet and the music so relax.
Perfect for couples and family with children and elderly.
Come back here every time I visit Vung Tau, but this time with family. Glad to see the business is booming while still maintaining its quality. Canâ€™t wait to come back for more!
A very clean and pleasant spot. The food was exceptional, especially for the price. Weâ€™ve just found our new favorite place to eat!"

Excellent atmosphere with great choices of beer!
Also very attentive staffs.

Food was good, service was attentive.
Vibe is like an industrial place in a good way.
You get a free dish if you review them, which isnâ€™t necessary as they would deserve a good review anyway.

Best steak I have gotten here. After all the Vietnamese food (especially seafood) we were craving this. The ribeye steak was cooked medium rare and the corn and scallops were an good addition. Would recommend and come back
So delicious! Great price and perfectly cooked steak, everyone should experience Black Pan ðŸ¤©

This restaurant has sushi, pasta, and steak, and I only tried their steak. I wanted to have ribeyes, but it was sold out, so I had top blade and hokubee. I like their top blade over hokubee even though hokubee is priced much higher. The beef bowls I had were also decent and the top blade beef bowl was pretty good especially.

Great steak restaurant. My wife and I often go for special occasions. Itâ€™s not cheap but it also a good value for the money. Lots of good food. My wife, who is Viá»‡t, especially loves the steak. But really everything is prepared well. The service is also very good. But the place is small so go early or go late.
Nice food and amazing atmosphere. We tried Ribeye, Salmon and Unagi rice. The stir-fried corn with scallops is a good option to have with beer. Their staffs are friendly and helpful. Must try ðŸ¤“
I was feeling homesick so I came here for comfort food and omgâ€¦ best steak and sushi in Vung Tau! Super yummy, me and mum loved it!
The food was absolutely delicious and the service was great. The order came out super fast. All exactly as shown.

This is not a steak , it  is meat with some injections to make it so tender that you don't need a knife. You will feel that the texture is not meat anymore. Not a place for meat. They have the Japanese option which seems the popular choice. We ordered Hokubee and Ribeye hoping for a tasty dinner.

Cozy atmosphere and delicious foods, this restaurant offers a variety of choices for dining. The steaks are perfectly cooked to your preference, and the side dishes are also delicious. The staff is friendly, I would recommend this restaurant and will definitely return for more.

Great food
Steaks are tasety.
Beef rice / spagetthi also good.

Best with variety of imported beers  and some wines.

My wife and I spent the day traveling from hanoi, flew into hcmc and got a private car to vung tau.

Looked around on maps for a restaurant, this one made the short list.  So glad we came here first!  Probably will come back.
Best squid weve had in our month here in vietnam.  Steak was perfect, melted in your mouth.  Sushi was excellent.  Reasonable prices.

Tan Phuc was our server, he was fantastic!  Even spoke english.  6/5 stars, will probably be back before we leave vung tau (are here for a little less than a week.
Enjoyed an array of food beautifully presented. Salmon was cooked perfectly. Rib eye steak was brilliant. Spag bol was amazing . Highly recommend
Great steakhouse. I think it would be better if its open space as it is quite loud on the day we eat. Delicious steak with great price

I visited Black Pan Steak in VÅ©ng TÃ u, Vietnam, after a long day of exploring, and it was one of the best dining experiences Iâ€™ve had in my three years of traveling across Asia. I was starving, so I ordered two meals: sushi and the Hokubee steak. The sushi was fresh and delicious, but the Hokubee steak stole the showâ€”it was, hands down, the best steak Iâ€™ve ever had.

Itâ€™s rare (no pun intended) to find a restaurant that gets a rare steak cooked perfectly, but Black Pan Steak nailed it. Most places overcook or underseason it, leaving me disappointed and wishing Iâ€™d grilled it myself. Not hereâ€”the steak was absolutely flawless, so much so that I came back the very next day and ordered two portions.

The staff were incredibly friendly, attentive, and made me feel right at home. Their hospitality was top-notch, which added to the overall amazing experience.

If youâ€™re in VÅ©ng TÃ u, you have to stop at Black Pan Steak. The food, service, and atmosphere are truly exceptional. Iâ€™m already planning to return a few more times before heading to my next destination. 10/10 recommend!

We spent 7 days in Vung Tau and this was the best restaurant we found on the journey. Food was served fast and was excellent. We had tuna, egg salad, beef, french fries and duck. This was our first visit to the Offshore and we came specificaly for the Sunday Roast. The decor is clean and simple with great seating, with outdoor and indoor seating to choose from. The menu has all the Western dishes one could crave for, from breakfast, lunch and dinner entrees. The Sunday Roast was hands down as good as Moms home cooking on a Sunday dinner. The pork roast was moist and served up with a generous portion of potato, roast root vegetables, roasted pumpkin, cauliflower, brocolli and peas, along with a very flavourfull gravy. I can understand how they sell out early, so its best to reserve or come early. Being only 300 meters from the Melody on a quite residental street it has ease of access. I would highly recomend eating here, for great food, personable friendly owners and a relaxing atmosphere. Great job gentlemen! See you again real soon, this time with our two daughters to sample more on the menu!

I went last night, because i was looking for some good western/European food, and this was the best choice i have ever made, it all looked so good, so we took the chicken parmigiana (which for me was one of the best ive actually ate in my life), one Mexican pizza and one Hawaiian pizza.(i recommend trying as well the peper sauce and the tartar as an extra!! This is the second time i come to Vietnam, and this is by far the best western/European food that i have tried here.
The taste was phenomenal for both pizza and the chicken, the food is really fresh, the portions are generous and the service is just amazing, even though i ordered to go, the service was very very good from Victor!!
Sadly i found this restaurant on my last day in Vung Tau, but im 100% sure that whenever i come back, this place will be my 1st stop!!

This is the best place I've been to in Vung Tau. This is already my fifth visit. Everything on the menu was delicious.

Hoi, the chef and Victor run a clean cool restaurant with a great menu and the prices the cheapest i have come across in Vung Tau. My favourites are the crumbed Sea Bass, the Pork Spare Ribs, and the thin and crispy Seafood Pizza. They will also deliver if you get caught at the pub, at no extra charge.

I came here on a rainy Sunday afternoon, slightly damp from the rain for some very tasty homestyle food. It being Sunday, I chose the Sunday Roast. It was a large plate with great meat and gravy with some roasted vegetables, potatoes, sweet potato, onion, carrot, broccoli, cauliflower and some peas.

The location of the restaurant is not far off the main PCT road, perhaps 200m down Phan Huy Ich.

If I lived in VungTau, I'd eat this every Sunday.

Reasonable prices, good food and environment.  Enthusiastic staff.

A diner worth recommending. A new place, clean with a nice view and reasonable prices. Open every day from 8 AM. The owner Victor is a Malaysian sweetheart, that carries a hint of Singaporean culture that enriches the experience.

Along a small street lined with cute hotels, far from the hustle and bustle of the beachfront, this little restaurant serves up an amazing breakfast for two, costing less than â‚¬4. The waiter speaks both English and French, a truly simple moment of bliss. Don't hesitate to go there.

This was our first visit to the Offshore and we came specificaly for the Sunday Roast. The decor is clean and simple with great seating, with outdoor and indoor seating to choose from. The menu has all the Western dishes one could crave for, from breakfast, lunch and dinner entrees. The Sunday Roast was hands down as good as Moms home cooking on a Sunday dinner. The pork roast was moist and served up with a generous portion of potato, roast root vegetables, roasted pumpkin, cauliflower, brocolli and peas, along with a very flavourfull gravy. I can understand how they sell out early, so its best to reserve or come early. Being only 300 meters from the Melody on a quite residental street it has ease of access. I would highly recomend eating here, for great food, personable friendly owners and a relaxing atmosphere. Great job gentlemen! See you again real soon, this time with our two daughters to sample more on the menu!

I recently had the pleasure of dining here, and everything from the atmosphere to the service was top-notch. But what truly stood out was the pumpkin soup â€“ hands down one of the best I've ever tasted.

Creamy, rich, and perfectly seasoned, it had a beautiful balance of sweetness and savory depth. The texture was silky smooth, with just a hint of nutmeg and perhaps a touch of ginger that gave it a comforting warmth. Served hot with a side of crusty bread, it was the perfect starter â€“ or honestly, a satisfying meal on its own.

You can tell itâ€™s made from scratch with quality ingredients. If youâ€™re visiting, do yourself a favor and order the pumpkin soup. Itâ€™s a standout dish that turns a simple classic into something truly memorable.

Highly recommended â€“ Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back for more!

Been a couple of times as a new resident in Vung Tau and going again. Had a beetroot soup, seafood pizza and roast beef dinner on my two visits. The beetroot soup was prepared beautifully, just a different sweeter style. The pizza was first rate, both toppings and base while the beef was amazing quality with a good choice of tasty vegetables. Friendly place where I will go often.

Hands down our favorite spot in vung tau. The staff are absolutely awesome, super friendly and accommodating. Delicious food at very reasonable prices. The new location is breezy and beautiful. All round good vibes  ðŸ’¯% recommend ðŸ‘Œ

Inside, we really love the interior decorations that was casual, bright and lively. Thereâ€™s a huge lobster cartoon painted on the main wall of the restaurant and if you look really carefully, youâ€™ll find a few â€œNemoâ€™sâ€ (clown fish) on the mural as well. The staff were also really friendly, making recommendations for the dishes. Thanks to the recommendation, we tried something that weâ€™ve not really tasted before but really enjoyed. Upon being seated, we were given the menu and in our minds, we had an idea of what we wanted to have. From the reviews, we saw that the grilled prawns were ordered quite frequently and we ordered a dish of 7 prawns. The staff did share that these were frozen and not live prawns but we were quite happy with our selection thereafter.

We also knew that we wanted to have some crabs as we donâ€™t normally have them in Singapore. Unlike what we saw from the menus online, Quachâ€™s have actually improved their menu by including the /kg prices of the live crabs, lobsters and prawns. This is unlike what it did previously with â€œmarket pricesâ€. With this, the prices would probably be a little higher but for customers, you know that there would be no haggling of prices here.

Moreover, to add to the transparency, we were asked which type of mud crabs we wanted (female with roe are slightly more expensive) and they were picked and weighed out on the scale in our presence. The bucket was â€œzeroedâ€ first so that the scale with the bucket was at â€œ0kgâ€, allowing the weight of the crabs to be displayed when placed within the bucket. We also asked if we could have two different crabs with two different styles of preparations â€“ to which the staff readily agreed. Later, we found that there was no additional charges for this arrangement as well...

For more details on what we had at Quach's Seafood Restaurant Vung Tau, visit 2bearbear today!

Had one of the best dining experiences in Vietnam. Flavors were on point and delicious, staff were all so warm and attentive, the place had such a warm, homey and comfortable vibe. Prices were also very reasonable. Will definitely go back here when I get to visit Vung Tau again. Aside from the fresh and tasty seafood, I think what really impressed me is the hospitality that the staff showed. I hope you can keep providing travellers with hearty seafood meals and amazing service for many many more years to come. I highly recommend this awesome restaurant!
Staff is very accommodating and friendly. They welcome us with a smile. Must try is the deep fried baby squid. My personal favorite is egg fried rice.
Great food, well prepared, attention to details. Very well-trained and responsive staff. Most of the food I ordered was good, except the stingray hotpot. It was mediocre.

I had high expectation from this restaurant. Itâ€™s one of the highest rated seafood restaurants in Vung Tau even though it costs close to double of its competitors (Oc Thu Nhien). This is why I decided to go there to have a seafood dinner.

Unfortunately for me, I left disappointed. I should have known when the restaurant was empty during dinner time on a Saturday night. Though the service staff are attentive, helpful and can speak English, I am penalising the restaurant because of the food. Letâ€™s break down what I ordered one by one:

Crab meat fried rice
- There was barely any crab meat in there. A few shredded pieces.
- The fried rice was very dry.

Garlic butter small lobster
- The seasoning was great.
- Portion size for 2-3 people.
- Toughest small lobster I have ever had in my life. Just to cut the flesh, I thought I was going to break my metal fork and spoon. An absolutely let down.

Salted egg soft shell crab
- Presentation definitely could be improved. The picture showed a dry version so I was surprised when it came out covered in sauce.
- Taste and flavour is good.

Overall, I wouldnâ€™t go back there again. Paid 980k for these 3 dishes including a pink guava tea.

We visited just a little past lunchtime on a weekday and we were greeted by lovely staff. The food was spectacular though we ordered way too much. Crab was wonderful, and so was the fresh pomfret. The baby pumpkin ( which was actually baby zucchini was delicious, and so were the razor clams with morning glory. The crab asparagus soup was also delightful. All in all, a great meal with fabulous value for money. Note it is a seafood specialty place- whilst there are non seafood choices weâ€™d highly recommend ordering seafood

One of the best local Vietnamese restaurants in the Vung Tau area, especially for seafood lovers. The dishes were incredibly delicious, and everyone enjoyed the meal. The only downside was that desserts were not served after the meal, which was a bit disappointing. Otherwise, everything else was great!

The staff is friendly and also explained clearly about what is their recommendation. The food is fresh and tastes good. The price is also reasonable. Not so crowded after lunch hour which is good for someone who likes a quiet dining environment. Must order baby pumpkin, tastes good!

Waitress immediately turned on A/C when I asked. She also read my mind and turned down the Viet pop music. She seemed a little unhappy (about her job?) though.

Food portion (baby pumpkin', i.e. zucchini) was small to moderate and rather expensive at 85K. Mix of real fresh garlic and fried dried. Smelled good. Tasted excellent. What I especially liked was how it was hot temperature and not sloppy wet.  I will order this same vegetable, with its crunchy ends - somewhere else next time. I might come back here for scallops *if someone else is paying*.

Note: photo of cooked vegetable is before I took a bite.

Great seafood restaurant. Nice atmosphere with friendly staff (that do speak English if you need). They also have western beer on tap as well. Tried many different dishes and I enjoyed them all. If you are in the area give them a look.

Never, ever trust the Google reviews or ratings for this restaurant. The ratings are blatantly false and misleading. The food is absolutely terrible, and the prices are absurdly high. We came here as a family, hoping for a nice seafood meal, but ended up having a thoroughly miserable experience. This restaurant tarnishes the reputation of beautiful Vung Tau. It was so bad that after eating here, our family had no choice but to return to our hotel and eat instant noodles.

I visited this restaurant after seeing its high reviews. I ordered the stir-fried noodles with vegetables and the crab meat soup with mushrooms. The portion size of the stir-fried noodles was quite large, enough for 2-3 people, but it was a bit greasy and salty for my taste. The soup was good but resembled more of an egg drop soup than what I expected. Also, be aware that the restaurant charges 3000 VND for using the wet towels provided, as well as for the bag of crackers placed on the table. Additionally, they add a 3% fee for credit card payments. While my waitress was kind, one of the waitstaff, who spoke some English, wasnâ€™t very friendly.

We came two times during the trip. Really fresh seafood, price is fair and most importantly very open and transparent. Environment is clean and nice. The food taste is more common Asian taste rather than a lot sweet sour local food .   Service person speaks decent English .

Almost every dish we order is great . Especially love the fresh crab, oyster, and pork ribs clay pot.

Quach Seafood in Vung Tau is a great spot for those who prefer a quiet, uncrowded place with fresh seafood and friendly service. The food is decent, the atmosphere is cozy with air-conditioning, and thereâ€™s convenient street parking. Perfect for couples or families looking for a relaxed dining exá»…prience.

If there were more stars to tick, I would.  The staff are beautiful and super helpful. We didn't order anything as we were suggested a few things, and it was as if they were in our head.
Oysters to start, Prawns in the middle and finished off with a whole groper fish. Nearly forgot about the fried rice. Probably the best I've had. ðŸ‘Œ

I'll be back next time I'm in Vung Tau.

Fresh seafood, super delicious, we came with my boyfriend and ordered 6 dishes of seafood including 1 big crab. The bill out is only 1.34 Million. What's a surprise!

However, this restaurant is not seaside. Don't expect for the good view

Recently dined at this gem of a seafood restaurant in Vung Tau, and I couldn't be happier with the experience! From the moment we walked in, the staff greeted me with the warmest smiles. Every dish I tried was a delightful journey for my taste buds, especially the salted egg blue crab. The service was exceptional throughout the meal, with the staff going above and beyond to ensure our dining experience was nothing short of perfect. A must-visit for seafood lovers visiting Vung Tau. Highly recommended!
Small but nice restaurant. Staffs are very supportive. Highly recommend.

This is the best seafood I've ever had, the crab and lobster are so big it takes 3 of us to finish it. The salted egg sauce for the crab tastes like heaven ðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘Œ. The other seafoods  are also very delicious.

The staffs are very accommodating and can speak a little basic english (so don't worry if you are a foreigner). Very recommended if you are looking to have a delicious, fulfilling and affordable seafood.

The grilled pomfret in chili salt was very fresh and done to perfection. I also enjoyed the oysters in onion sauce. The oysters in cheese are good too but the taste was more sour than I expected. Extremely friendly service.

We had a delicious dinner and our waitress Dang Tran was lovely. Her English was very good. It's the slow season (hence the low rating for atmosphere) so we were the only people upstairs - but there was a party of locals down stairs.

Dinner with my family, everything very good
Food quality, services , staff also.
Highly recommend.

I came here due to the good reviews and wasnâ€™t disappointed! The staff were so friendly and sweet. The fish was also a good size and delicious. Their English was really good so it was great to have a chat with them.

I have allergies and they were helpful negotiating them and even gave me watermelon for desert. I highly recommend the restaurant.

One of the very few good restaurants in Vung Tau in my opinion! 4.9 is a bit too much I think, I would probably rate this as a 4.3-4.4 back home.

+ the salmon with lemon butter sauce was quite good, but a bit expensive
+ the pork spring rolls and the vegetable stir fried noodles were good
+ good coffee (americano) and mango smoothie
+ the waiters are very friendly, they speak english and the service is very fast

- I ordered 400 grams of tiger prawns and got 10 prawns. They were smaller than I expected and it is really hard to peel them because they donâ€™t cut the shrimps in half. They were tasty, but I got way better price quality ratio in Ho Chi Minh, which is surprising to me given that Vung Tau is near the sea and most restaurants here serve seafood

Food were good and extremely well prepared. Can assist English speaking customer. For me authentic Vietnamese food. Prices are reasonable  800k dong, oysters, scallops, seafood salad, 2 order spring roll, baby squid and drinks. Free bite dessert.

Visited Vung Tau on 4/29. Had my luch and dinner here. The day time menu is serving for brunch and the dinner menu is for sea food mainly. Good quality food with cozy environment. Surely will   come back with friends for my next trip to Vung Tau.
I really enjoy and love here very good service and food staff also really nice friendly, im sure to come back this place again. (Im from Thailand ðŸ˜Š)

It was our first time here and it was an amazing experience! The food was fresh and suited our taste perfectly. The staff was very nice and welcoming as well. Would definitely recommend friends and family members to visit here!!

The best restaurant in Vung Tau! Food is epic (seafood is super fresh, cooked to perfection!), atmosphere is nice, open and clean and staffs are extremely attentive and friendly (especially Huong is the star ðŸ˜Š). If we return to Vung Tau, we will absolutely return to this place and recommend to everyone who plans to visit Vung Tau.
good food, great vibe. Lovely staffs, the service is 10/10 for me :) Highly recommended

I am not sure if the people and service or the food is better. I felt so welcomed. The people were great, friendly and easy to communicate with. Almost never I write reviews but this place does deserve its title 5stars seafood place in Vung tau
Service was great. The waitress took initiative to take picture for us and recommended a few dishes. Fish was fresh & tender. We love it.

My family and I, all the way from Kien Giang, had an amazing dining experience at Quach Seafood Restaurant. The oysters with wasabi were incredibly fresh and flavorful, providing a unique and delightful combination of tastes. The live prawns with salt and chili were cooked to perfection, with a perfect balance of seasoning and spice. The fried rice with garlic was a delicious accompaniment, adding a savory note to the meal. I couldn't be happier with the food; it's a solid 10/10 in my book! What's more, the staff was exceptionally professional, adding to the overall enjoyable atmosphere. And to top it off, the prices were so affordable! We were pleasantly surprised by the value for money we received. I highly recommend this restaurant for its exceptional seafood, wonderful flavors, top-notch service, and budget-friendly prices.
Lovely staff, extremely clean in all areas including bathroom. Food was great. The silver pomfret was absolutely amazing. I'd come back just for that! Definitely recommend this place â¤ï¸

Excellent indoor atmosphere. Very clean place to dine in and felt very comfortable eating here. Seafood here is very fresh and big sized. Cooked deliciously. Lastly, service is very good. Really enjoyed it here and will be back if I ever come to vietnam again ðŸ˜ƒ

P.S. only took photos of some food

Quality, fresh and sumptuous seafood! We came here twice across our time here in Vung Tau. Tried different dishes each time and do recommend the baby squid as well as the fresh grilled prawns. Staff were always so attentive and friendly towards us. Do give them a visit for a wonderful seafood meal!

This restaurant will be my favourite seafood restaurant from Vung Tau from now on. Food and service from staff are amazing! I will definitely come back to this restaurant everytime I visit Vung Tau :)
We found this restaurant based off the Google reviews and it did not disappoint. Amazing seafood and wonderful staff! Highly recommend.

Quach's Seafood was a great mix of great quality, super-fresh seafood (we had Crab, King Prawns, Oysters and Razor Clams), served by hard working, efficient but also smiling and friendly staff who can all speak a little English. The owner can speak more English if needed and as a former worker at Belly's Watering Hole, she knows a bit about customer service! Beer goes for 20,000D for local and they also have some mid range wines if you prefer that. This proved to be an excellent evening out and I thoroughly recommend it!
We had a great dinner here recently and then returned the next day for lunch! The restaurant had a lovely ambience and the staff were very helpful and advised on the menu and spoke English.

This establishment will place on the bill secret charges that you don't know about. BEWARE. Charged for petty items like serviettes, wet towels, and peanuts. Will not come back. We gave them big tip! and didn't notice the other charges until  we got home.
Great seafood! We were able to pick out the fish we wanted. Neat experience. Excellent service and the food was delicious

Amazing friendly staff. Greet you right at the entrance and show you to your seat. Smiling while giving tips on what to order.

Had baby pumpkin with garlic. Delicious!!!

The place is clean with freshly made food

The ratings are a bit exaggerated. It took them 20mins to bring us our first dish, and the restaurant was not that crowded. Other tables waited 15-20 as well. The food was good, but barely good enough to justify wait time.

Edit: they finally brought out the softshell crabs. They were soooo small (my lady friend's tiny hand for scale).

We had an amazing experience going there for lunch. Every single dish from the vegetables, fish, fried rice down to the drinks were delicious! Pricing is transparent and service is the most friendly! 10/10 highly recommend!

Absolutely amazing...the reviews are correct.
Amazing staff...and prices. We lashed out and ordered our favourites including live lobster.  We couldn't fault 1 dish and really felt like we had the freshest and best quality seafood around.
Our server Thu was a beautiful lady and so friendly.  Our first night in Vung Tau (no...its not our 1st visit.

We will be back before we leave.
Paul & Nat...Australia

Very friendly staff with good English.  ðŸ‘  Each portion of food is pretty big, so please be aware... I am sure each dish can be shared by 2-3.

This is definitely one of the best restaurants in Vung Tau City. The grilled fish in garlic sauce was the best that Iâ€™ve ever eaten in my whole life. And also the baked prawn with cheese was awesome! Iâ€™ll be here for more plenty of times, thatâ€™s for sure!

We are living temporarily in VÅ©ngTÃ u (Vietnam) and we often have our meals at Quach's... wonderful food, perfect service, air-conditioned and very pleasant environment!!!  We love!!

These items were left on our table! We were never advised that these items were chargeable! I am not impressed and this is WARNING to all diners! We ate here because of the reviews sadly it was the worst food we have eaten in Vietnam. The snails we rubbery like overcooked squid, the chips with the fish & chips were frozen packaged type. The waitress as average. We had seafood before at Hai San Thanh Phat 1 and sadly compared to that Quachâ€™s is a 2. Expensive, and mediocre.

The service is great, the staff is very friendly. But the food is just average. And they charge you for items that are usually complimentary in other restaurants. I don't see a reason why the rating is so high
seems pricey
This unassuming seafood restaurant looks just like countless others, BUT, the food and service are amazing.

Inside, we really love the interior decorations that was casual, bright and lively. Thereâ€™s a huge lobster cartoon painted on the main wall of the restaurant and if you look really carefully, youâ€™ll find a few â€œNemoâ€™sâ€ (clown fish) on the mural as well. The staff were also really friendly, making recommendations for the dishes. Thanks to the recommendation, we tried something that weâ€™ve not really tasted before but really enjoyed. Upon being seated, we were given the menu and in our minds, we had an idea of what we wanted to have. From the reviews, we saw that the grilled prawns were ordered quite frequently and we ordered a dish of 7 prawns. The staff did share that these were frozen and not live prawns but we were quite happy with our selection thereafter.

We also knew that we wanted to have some crabs as we donâ€™t normally have them in Singapore. Unlike what we saw from the menus online, Quachâ€™s have actually improved their menu by including the /kg prices of the live crabs, lobsters and prawns. This is unlike what it did previously with â€œmarket pricesâ€. With this, the prices would probably be a little higher but for customers, you know that there would be no haggling of prices here.

Moreover, to add to the transparency, we were asked which type of mud crabs we wanted (female with roe are slightly more expensive) and they were picked and weighed out on the scale in our presence. The bucket was â€œzeroedâ€ first so that the scale with the bucket was at â€œ0kgâ€, allowing the weight of the crabs to be displayed when placed within the bucket. We also asked if we could have two different crabs with two different styles of preparations â€“ to which the staff readily agreed. Later, we found that there was no additional charges for this arrangement as well...

For more details on what we had at Quach's Seafood Restaurant Vung Tau, visit 2bearbear today!

Had one of the best dining experiences in Vietnam. Flavors were on point and delicious, staff were all so warm and attentive, the place had such a warm, homey and comfortable vibe. Prices were also very reasonable. Will definitely go back here when I get to visit Vung Tau again. Aside from the fresh and tasty seafood, I think what really impressed me is the hospitality that the staff showed. I hope you can keep providing travellers with hearty seafood meals and amazing service for many many more years to come. I highly recommend this awesome restaurant!
Staff is very accommodating and friendly. They welcome us with a smile. Must try is the deep fried baby squid. My personal favorite is egg fried rice.
Great food, well prepared, attention to details. Very well-trained and responsive staff. Most of the food I ordered was good, except the stingray hotpot. It was mediocre.

I had high expectation from this restaurant. Itâ€™s one of the highest rated seafood restaurants in Vung Tau even though it costs close to double of its competitors (Oc Thu Nhien). This is why I decided to go there to have a seafood dinner.

Unfortunately for me, I left disappointed. I should have known when the restaurant was empty during dinner time on a Saturday night. Though the service staff are attentive, helpful and can speak English, I am penalising the restaurant because of the food. Letâ€™s break down what I ordered one by one:

Crab meat fried rice
- There was barely any crab meat in there. A few shredded pieces.
- The fried rice was very dry.

Garlic butter small lobster
- The seasoning was great.
- Portion size for 2-3 people.
- Toughest small lobster I have ever had in my life. Just to cut the flesh, I thought I was going to break my metal fork and spoon. An absolutely let down.

Salted egg soft shell crab
- Presentation definitely could be improved. The picture showed a dry version so I was surprised when it came out covered in sauce.
- Taste and flavour is good.

Overall, I wouldnâ€™t go back there again. Paid 980k for these 3 dishes including a pink guava tea.

We visited just a little past lunchtime on a weekday and we were greeted by lovely staff. The food was spectacular though we ordered way too much. Crab was wonderful, and so was the fresh pomfret. The baby pumpkin ( which was actually baby zucchini was delicious, and so were the razor clams with morning glory. The crab asparagus soup was also delightful. All in all, a great meal with fabulous value for money. Note it is a seafood specialty place- whilst there are non seafood choices weâ€™d highly recommend ordering seafood

One of the best local Vietnamese restaurants in the Vung Tau area, especially for seafood lovers. The dishes were incredibly delicious, and everyone enjoyed the meal. The only downside was that desserts were not served after the meal, which was a bit disappointing. Otherwise, everything else was great!

The staff is friendly and also explained clearly about what is their recommendation. The food is fresh and tastes good. The price is also reasonable. Not so crowded after lunch hour which is good for someone who likes a quiet dining environment. Must order baby pumpkin, tastes good!

Waitress immediately turned on A/C when I asked. She also read my mind and turned down the Viet pop music. She seemed a little unhappy (about her job?) though.

Food portion (baby pumpkin', i.e. zucchini) was small to moderate and rather expensive at 85K. Mix of real fresh garlic and fried dried. Smelled good. Tasted excellent. What I especially liked was how it was hot temperature and not sloppy wet.  I will order this same vegetable, with its crunchy ends - somewhere else next time. I might come back here for scallops *if someone else is paying*.

Note: photo of cooked vegetable is before I took a bite.

The place was nice and pretty. The vibe is good with perfect service and beachy decor. Food taste good with some hits or misses but great overall. Highly recommend the salted eggs sauce, perfectly seasoned. The price point was good too. Good family spot!

Was looking for a nice and quiet seafood restaurant which is still a short walk to many cafes and the beach.

We order prawn, chicken wing, squid, clam and morning glory. Each using different method of cooking. Salt & Spice, Roast with salt, Grill, Thai Sauce and stir fry.

2 nice waitress serve us and speak some English.
So that makes the experience wonderful and pleasant.

A beautiful wee local place, lovely decorations and very clean.

The staff were very attentive, and the food is some of the best I've had since arriving in Vietnam. Some of our crew have been several times now, and they've translated the menu which was very much appreciated and shows just how good the staff are! If that's not going above and beyond, I don't know what is.

We had dinner twice in this lovely restaurant. It is a really must-try location for visitors to get this city. Price is really cheap with fresh and delicious seafoods. Service is also fast although it is always crowded. I will visit it again.

The restaurant is spacious, airy, the staff is friendly, the food is served quickly, the spices are good. Fresh and delicious seafood. Reasonable prices. Crab, stir-fried water spinach, blood cockles, scallops, clams, fried rice, 1 beer, 2 people for 1,060,000 VND)

The space is also moderate, but the upstairs is more airy. The food is average, compared to the price it is okay. However, the salted egg sauce is not delicious, has a musty smell. Spacious, cool space, suitable for families, delicious food, reasonable price, everyone can experience it.

Delicious food, fast service, enthusiastic and attentive staff

+ very spacious and cool space.

+ food: although the restaurant has about 25 tables, the food is served very quickly and the staff remembers the dishes very well.

Understand why they have opened 4 branches.

What a great experience.
Go eat according to google map, not tiktok review

Went at noon but the space was still cool, the staff was enthusiastic, went on the weekend and waited about 10-30 minutes for all 6 dishes to be served, which was quite fast, the food portion was reasonable for the price. Worth the experience and will try again early next month (after the 5th) <3
Fresh seafood, reasonable price.
I saw a lot of reviews on tiktok, when I came to eat, all the dishes were okay but not delicious, the price was also relatively high.

Every time my family comes here! Favorite restaurant

Seeing the high reviews, I stopped by to try it out, but was completely disappointed. The food was really bad, the price wasn't cheap, never coming back.

I saw on tiktok that everyone said it was delicious, nutritious and cheap so I went with them but was disappointed and didn't know what to say. The restaurant was crowded but the food didn't come out too long. The food was nothing special, the portion was a bit small, and the price was high. The noodles had a lot of water spinach, the snails were big but I don't know if it was because they were crowded but they had a strange smell and tasted bland. The steamed clams were bland even though they were big. The most disappointing thing was the crab claws, the amount of meat wasn't enough to fit between my teeth. The total of 7 dishes was 700 more but the food was okay but not delicious and worth the money.
Delicious food, reasonable price, attentive staff, will come back next time
Delicious food, reasonable price. Staff is cheerful and enthusiastic, food is served very quickly. The restaurant atmosphere is very warm. 10 points, no complaints

To put it bluntly, the restaurant hires seeders too much even though the quality is not commensurate.

My group visited the restaurant because they saw that the reviews on the map were quite high, so they also stopped by to try it out, but the experience was very bad.

- The price of the dishes is not cheap, but the amount of food is too little, the taste is not too delicious but just okay, even a bit bland with some dishes, to put it bluntly, the price is very expensive compared to the quality, not at all stable prices like many seeding reviews
- The service is quite bad, the food takes a long time to be brought out even though the restaurant is not too crowded and I only went on a weekday, the hot pot was brought out but even after 10-15 minutes the noodles still hadn't come out, and there was no hot pot ladle, even the things that should be prepared like dipping sauce were completely absent, I had to proactively ask for it
+ The only plus point I see in this restaurant is that the security guard is very cheerful, enthusiastic, and cute.

Even though the experience was very bad about the quality of the restaurant, if there were any good points, I would still give it a fair review. The attached photo is to prove that my group actually visited and ate at the restaurant, not to give a negative review or anything. This is my review from the perspective of a customer who has experienced the restaurant. I hope the restaurant will take note to really improve the quality of the food as well as the service process, not hire seeding to attract customers like they are doing.
Clean restaurant, delicious food, enthusiastic take care staff. Especially the restaurant serves food very quickly. Will definitely come back next time.
The food is delicious, suitable for the taste, reasonable price, the staff here are very cute. It was so delicious that the table was empty.
The food is okay but the portion is a bit small for 4 people, but the price is reasonable. The waiter is quick and easy to please. The atmosphere is not impressive but neat and clean is okay.
Good food and good service
Delicious food, suitable for taste, reasonable price, the staff here are very cute, the food comes out quickly
The restaurant is quite nice and airy. The food is delicious, the price is reasonable, but the Thai octopus sauce is a bit bland.
Fresh and delicious food, I have been there several times and will continue to support.

I am a tourist, visiting the restaurant on a holiday with NO SURCHARGE NO VAT, I chose 2 airy spaces with wind, tables for 2-6 people, sitting near the counter for quick payment
+ I came to the restaurant at 6:30 am, those who eat early should go at this time, the order is good, each dish is delivered to the table quickly and conveniently, 10 points for the waiters on the 2nd floor
+ I ordered 6 dishes, total bill 420k, too cheap and delicious, 10 points for each dish
*Snails with egg sauce
*Mantis shrimp with lice
*Snails stir-fried with coconut
*Oysters grilled with scallion oil
*Blood cockles with tamarind sauce
*Crab pieces (the crab is not really dry, order this dish in advance because it dries quickly)
+ The menu is reasonably priced, it is a bit slow, but when paying, please ask for a tip of 10 VND for sophistication
+ The drinks are ok, order quickly to order early because the restaurant is a bit crowded
Cheap meal for two people, about 400, very delicious food, suitable for everyone's taste, including oysters, stir-fried crab pieces

The food is sweet, with coconut milk, and it becomes a sweet soup shop.
The staff is boring, sitting without a bowl or towel, thinking the restaurant's style is to eat by hand. After a lot of begging, the staff was able to give me 4 bowls, while there were 6 people.
Disappointed, stir-fried dishes are very sweet, hot pot is also sweet, stir-fried clams with scallion oil are crazy sweet, the others are okay
Delicious food, enthusiastic staff, spacious space
good food, good service
The food is delicious, the service is also good.
Hoy hoy, no need to ask, every time I go I stop by for a drink, reasonable price, good food, no need to discuss, you should stop by.

Coming to Oc Diem 2, I immersed myself in the vibrant street food atmosphere typical of Vung Tau. The restaurant is always bustling with customers coming and going, the space is bustling with laughter, the sound of clinking glasses and the strong aroma of grilled and stir-fried seafood emanating from the kitchen. This is truly a familiar meeting place, imbued with a rustic and close atmosphere. 

The most impressive thing is the variety and freshness of the snails and clams. From fatty salted egg snails, fragrant grilled scallops with scallion oil, to rich garlic butter stir-fried cockles or simply a plate of sweet lemongrass steamed clams. Everything is fresh, processed on the spot, hot and retains the original sweetness of the ocean. 

The seasoning is just right, not too fussy but highlights the freshness of the seafood. Sitting with friends, choosing snails yourself, enjoying each hot dish with a cool glass of beer, it is a true "sipping" experience. Oc Diem 2 is not a luxurious place, but a place to fully experience the delicious taste of fresh seafood and the open, genuine atmosphere of Vung Tau.
The food is fresh, the space is clean, the staff is friendly, the food comes out quickly. Overall, 10 points.
The upstairs space is airy, reasonable price, delicious food, will come back to support.

The restaurant has many delicious dishes
The food is rich.
The staff is friendly.
However, it is very crowded on weekends. Should go early
Delicious food, reasonable price, very enthusiastic staff
The food is fresh and delicious, especially the salted egg sauce is very tasty and has a lot of salted eggs, not mixed. The price is not cheap but not too expensive, acceptable!
Food comes out quickly, no need to wait long, friendly staff, the mantis shrimp dish is quite delicious
The food is delicious, suitable for my taste, price is OKðŸ¥°. Will come back to support again ðŸ¥°
The restaurant is very satisfying, the food is delicious, everyone who goes there remember to listen and experience it.

The restaurant looks fancy but the food prices are very reasonable. I went with 2 people, ordered 4 dishes and 2 soft drinks, total bill 310k. Every dish was delicious, for me Grilled Scallops with Cheese was the best, like that, now I have had cheese sauce that suits my taste so well. Everyone, remember to try the restaurant's best-selling dishes, they are delicious. With such quality of service and space, it's a great deal. Will come back next time I come to Vung Tau ðŸ’¯

The restaurant makes delicious food, the price is also quite reasonable. Especially the dishes with cheese, or salted egg sauce are very delicious.
The staff is cute, asked me "Is the food to your taste?"
In the picture are 7 dishes, my group of 6 people ate for 630k.

My family of 4 went for less than 900k, had snails, cheese oysters, Thai seafood sauce, hot pot, stir-fried squash. Every dish was super delicious and filling. Got 2 cans of beer or soft drinks for the Thai sauce dish. Without it, I couldn't eat it because it was too spicy.

Spacious restaurant, lots of seating. Upstairs. Can host parties, birthdays. Full lighting, cool fans, covered when it rains
Parking in front of the restaurant
Diverse menu, with highlight recommendations for easy selection. Excellent seasoning.
Small crabs so the price is reasonable
Friendly staff.

My colleagues and I stopped by to try it out. Everyone liked the clams, fried rice, lagu chicken cartilage, grilled oysters. Overall, the food was delicious, reasonably priced, and there was fragrant 1664 blanc beer. The space was suitable for family and friends. You should try it. The restaurant closes at 11pm.

Been eating at the restaurant for 2 years since going to Vung Tau.
Plus points:
- Cute staff
- Many branches so it's convenient to travel
- Diverse dishes from 29k ngaaa
ðŸ’¯ Reccommend brings experience

I went with 2 people: 464k.
The food was okay:
- Garlic butter snails: 5/5 delicious, rich in flavor.
- Cheese miso oysters: 5/5, sweet cheese.
- Salt-fried crab legs: 3/5, the restaurant used normal salt, I expected shrimp salt.
- Stir-fried fingernails with noodles: 3/5, not special.
- Mango salad: 3/5, a bit sour, not very rich.

Must say the food is delicious
Reasonable price for everyone

I read the reviews and saw a lot of praise. I went to eat and then regretted it. It was small and expensive. The hot pot broth was too sweet and bland. I wanted to try a new restaurant but was turned away.

Every time my family has guests coming to Vung Tau, I take them to this restaurant. The food is delicious, the staff is enthusiastic and friendly. The price is reasonable. My parents also really like the space and food of the restaurant.
The food is delicious, the price is reasonable, the atmosphere is cool.

Went for lunch but the restaurant was very cool because there were many trees. The service staff was lovely, I ordered sour milkfish hotpot, the fish had many delicious hotpot flavors. The cheese and miso oysters are extremely delicious, with fragrant fatty cheese left over. Will come back to support.

The restaurant is airy and clean.
Menu with many options.
Delicious food.
Enthusiastic staff.
Reasonable price.
Good food at reasonable prices

- The restaurant is clean, airy, no rubbish scattered under the table, the upper floor is usually more crowded
- Service: Friendly staff, quick service
- Food: The food is delicious, every dish is very ok, but I find the portion quite small, I can eat many dishes but not enough to fill me up

I stopped by the restaurant for lunch and dinner. The staff was ok, and there was someone watching the car so I felt very secure. The food here is delicious, the prices are reasonable, and the drinks are ok too. On holidays, you should book a table in advance or you won't have a table.
It's amazing, it's absolutely delicious, 100 points, delicious taste on every finger. Don't regret half your life ðŸ¥°
Good food. Reasonable price.

- Every dish is delicious
- Staff serve dishes quickly, enthusiastic service
- Reasonable price, very suitable for the dish
*The snail restaurant I think is the best in Vung Tau.
Recommended dish: Spicy butter stir-fried squid teeth
Delicious food, lovely, friendly and enthusiastic staff.
The restaurant is clean and airy, the food comes out quickly, the price is reasonable, and suits my taste. Everyone should try this restaurant.

- Seafood is very fresh

- The restaurant's salted egg sauce is very good
- Staff are too friendly and enthusiastic

Delicious food, lovely staff

I remember this as the best dinner I had on my last day in Vung Tau. It was reasonably clean (relative to other local restaurants), and although it was more expensive than other local restaurants, it was still affordable compared to other hotels or large seafood restaurants. The portions per dish were small, but the rice and noodles were generous. I liked it because the portions were small... In fact, you can eat a variety of delicious dishes, so I recommend it to families.
Fresh and delicious food, will come back if I have a chance to come to VT
The restaurant is clean and airy, the food is served quickly. The seafood is fresh, delicious, a little sweet, to my family's taste. I will come back.

We came here 2 days in row.
First day we ordered salmon pasta and bechamel sauce pizza.
Pasta was great, salmon was fresh and soft. Bechamel Pizza was a little bit bland, wish ham was a bit more salty.
Second day we ordered tuna pizza and risotto.
Tuna brought more flavor on pizza and was good. However risotto was underwhelming.
Staff seem well trained and friendly.
Overall it was a good place.

We've eaten at Ristorante Luca several times, both for lunch and dinner.

Very good food, excellent service, and excellent prices.

Authentic Italian food.

I highly recommend this restaurant.

For my taste, food quality werenâ€™t matched with the prices. Could have been better. Tiramisu was the worst dish, too sweet, soft (not sure that they used ladyfingers, but if they do then itâ€™s consistency was too strange), pasta was okay.
Amazing food taste, I didnâ€™t expect how good it is. My family was enjoyed it a lot. Service is good too. You guy can find a delicious italian food at Luca. 100% recommended.

Excepting pizza, the food is perfectly cooked according to my taste ðŸ‘… The pizzaâ€™s crust is a little bit dry so I am not really into it. The price is neutrally appropriate, not expensive as I expect for that such atmosphere and the meal I ordered.

The server is so friendly and so do the boss. The space is airy and the location is easy to find, which is suitable for having a freaking chilling dinner eating and chatting with buddies or family. Recommending every guests to come!!!!

The pizza is good, but other parts of the menu are weak. Iâ€™d recommend just ordering pizza and drinks. Donâ€™t order the stir-fried chicken with lemongrass. It came out drenched in oil and was terrible. Focus on the good stuff.
