Great place, highly recommended. I went here twice, which I very, very rarely do when traveling.
It's a nice location, with outdoor rooftop terrace seating and indoor ac space. The staff, including the boss/owner (?) are very friendly and competent.
The food is delicious: I had chicken with cheese and ham on my first visit and a pizza the second time. The pizza had a nice thin crust, generous toppings and was yummy! They have nice appetizers, desserts and a reasonably priced wine list as well! And you can pay by card, too.
We love the food and ate here many times during our stay. It never disappoints and is very affordable! If you want to eat proper Italian food, look no further! We will come back next year.

Coming from New York, I was in search of a good standard pepperoni pizza, it was very delicious and definitely similar to pizza back home. It was also spicy which I enjoyed. Worth the $6 for sure. I would like to try the lasagna next time :) I knew the food and service was going to be good when the worker was singing along to the music playing in the background ðŸ¤£

Discovered this place on the second last day in Vietnam and wish weâ€™d discovered this sooner. So far weâ€™ve had Italian at multiple places and this was by far the best, in terms of service, taste and pricing. Their pizza was even better than what we had at 4Ps in Ho Chi Minh City. The Desserts and cocktails were outstanding too. Highly, highly recommend this place.
Pizza was very good, I was not so impressed with the seafood fried rice. We needed to ask for soy sauce, it was not given automatically. In general a good experience
Pizza smells great, the crust was crunchy and the dough was thin. Nice place to have Pizza.

Very good Pizzas! Gor surprised with the taste of 4 cheeses and Margherita, probably the best ðŸ• I tried in Vung Tau.
The restaurant is right next to the lake which is very chilly in the evening. Plenty of foreigners have dinner here.

Ordered take away pizza. Overall it was very good. The salami pizza was a bit too salty, but still good. The seafood pizza was everyone's favorite. Large size is okay, and is similar in size to an American medium. It's a bit pricey, but it's definitely a more authentic pizza than other restaurants here. They were very busy even on a weeknight, and of course this place is super popular among foreigners. However, considering how busy it was, and that we ordered 4 pizzas, the service was reasonably fast. The online ordering was also quite smooth.

I was so surprised to find such a good Italian restaurant in VÅ©ng TÃ u. We arrived around 9 PM, and the restaurant was nearly full. We were lucky and thankful to a couple who saved us their table so we could sit together.

I noticed that the majority of customers were foreigners. The menu looked good, with a huge variety of options. I ordered a lot, and the food came out freshly made and quickly. Everything was so delicious that I forgot to take pictures of the dishes in their full appearance.

I loved the carpaccioâ€”simple and light with fresh beef tenderloin, Parma cheese, light citrus sauce, and minced capers. The best dish, in my opinion, was the lasagneâ€”absolutely the best Iâ€™ve ever had. The thin pasta layers were just al dente enough, the bolognese sauce was hearty and flavorful, and the melted cheese layer on top made for an unforgettable experience. I always order lasagne at Italian restaurants to gauge their flavor and style, and this one left me very satisfied and happy. Sometimes, a good dish can take your breath away and become a precious memory in life. Iâ€™m writing this review without having consumed any drinksâ€”I just got emotional about one good dish.

The other dishes were also delicious. The pizza crust was thin and crispy at the edges, and the toppings were fresh. The homemade pasta was perfectly al dente. The spaghetti alle vongole was a bit too oily, but the ink spaghetti with salmon was good.

There are so many good things about this restaurant. We will definitely come back for more. Highly recommended

P.s: we did come back for more. Itâ€™s my first time ever trying the home made cavatelli pastaâ€¦ a must try too.. not every Italian restaurant offers this kind of pasta.

Top quality restaurant, food, service, and ambience, a perfect 5 stars meal. Pizza crust is perfected and the vegetarian toppings are fresh, well cooked, and generous. Hands down my favorite restaurant in Vung Tau, Vietnam.
Amazing food, the service is great and they can communicate very well in english. We sat at the upper level which was very beautiful and comfortable. Good value as well, prices are very reasonable.

The best restaurant in Vung Tau and among the very few restaurants here with good food!

I came here three times simply because the quality was really good and there werenâ€™t other comparable options, except for 1 seafood restaurant.

+ I would recommend the lemongrass and chilli chicken. The portion is a bit small, but it is also quite cheap compared to other portions in the menu
+ the pizza is really good. Thin dough with a fluffy crust, quite tasty. I didnâ€™t expect to find good italian food in Vung Tau to be honest.
+ the stir fried noodles with seafood were really tasty! Much better than at other Vietnamese restaurants in Vung Tau
+ for desert, the semifreddo croccante was delicious!
+ the waiters are really friendly and the service is very fast

- the fillet steak is not great in my opinion. It was better than I expected tbh given the location, but still a rather average steak overall I would say.

Definitely recommend for yall to come and try their food. Delicious and fresh!
Will be back trying their pizza

Comforting Italian food. Great pizza. Great crust
Came back for the dessert soon
Need to up game their chili oil cause it's not hitting my Asian spicy tolerance
Amazing as always, we came back as we loved the dining experience with the extended family back at Christmas. Highly recommended. Proper Italian quality dishes.

They serve the best pizzas, better than the famous Pizza 4Ps around Vietnam, crusts are light and chewy. Drinks were really cold and refreshing for a really hot day, really appreciate that.

Service is excellent, however the aircon sitting area could be improved as it was a hot afternoon and the room felt warm too.

The dinner here absolutely made my day!
I had a plate of grilled chicken and a large pizza, and both were exceptionally good. Delicate yet satisfying â€” every ingredient was in perfect harmony.
The staff were very welcoming and helpful, and their English was excellent.
I just feel a little bad for not being able to say a single word in Vietnamese â€” I hope I didnâ€™t come across as rude.
Definitely recommend this place!

Lovely delicious vegan pizza with no vegan cheese. Lovely setting. Friendly staff. Good French fries
Update 30 minutes later: I've changed it from a 5 star to a 3 star. Why? A western restaurant allowing people to smoke! Come on, this is supposed to be a family friendly restaurant! Allowing people to smoke in front of children is a big no no. I was going to return tomorrow night, but we will find somewhere else. Ban smoking upstairs too if you want more customers. Smokers understand and will go outside to smoke their cancer.
This is the best pizza I have had in Vietnam. You can get a salad accompaniment and there is a good choice of beers. Prices are reasonable.
For me... This is the best Italian restaurant in VÅ©ng TÃ u by now ðŸŒŸðŸ‘ Strongly recommend â¤ï¸

We and my kids love this place right on first time dine-in, excellent dishes and great staff service. Every dish is tasty, excellent pizza, great soup, salmon and so onâ€¦ my daughter even order an extra seafood soup after she tastes it.
Love this place, we would come back definitely!!!
Great space, friendly staff, good food for the price

Authentic Italian food in Vung Tau, I admit it was a pleasant surprise. Price a bit high hence 4 stars although we order some overpriced drinks so next time will focus just on food. As a suggestion for atmosphere it could be good to add some Italian touches to the decor or play Italian music to counteract karoke from the neighbors.

Absolute treat. Lasagna is the dish to die for. Pizzas are well cooked using wood fired oven. Staffs and the manager/owner are very welcoming and attentiative to our needs.

Will definitely come back next time when I got the chance to try out steak menu.

I reviewed Luca before, but I decided to do it again after I took a proper photo. I order their Margherita pizza often. It is very thin crust, and they usually put a couple of basil leaves on top for good measure, although I have gotten a few without the basil. The best thing about Luca is the SPEED. Unless they are busy, which happens from time to time, they will have your order at your place in 10 to 15 minutes from the time you order! Now I only live about a kilometer away but that is still impressive.

The pizza itself is thin and light (the crust will flop down because it is so thin) and the large is very easy for one man to eat in one sitting, with room to spare. They put a little extra sauce on the one in the photo. I like to scarf mine down with a nice cold German ale. Salute! 5 stars.

--The Blue Knight

A friend recommended me this place after she shut her own restaurant. Was not one bit disappointed! The food was awesome, the staff was friendly and helpful, and willingly assists you with a genuine smile.

I got the minestrone, seafood pasta, and a Napoli pizza. 9/10 for the food, missing 1 because I wonâ€™t be back so soon for a visit ðŸ¥²

Cutie pie mascot goes woo woo woo when you enter the restaurant haha 15/10 a good and handsome boi
We had a great dining experience here. The pizza was great, the service was excellent, and they were very accommodating with regards to vegan options. Highly recommended!

It's pretty simple to make a mushroom and Onion pizza. I asked for well done extra cooked crispy crust. What I got was half cooked with canned mushrooms (Yes mushrooms for my can. not fresh) and one tiny piece of onion on each piece. That is not cheese you are looking at. It is half cooked pizza dough. I asked them to cook it more and they said no. That's the way it is. The other issue I have as I was leaving I went to wash my hands. One of the staff came out of the toilet, did not wash his hands and went right back into the kitchen started handling food. This is only my opinion. See for yourself before you order. Go back and wash your hands. The soap dispenser is full of water. Take a look in the kitchen as you walk by.

Great food ! Pizza and pasta at the highest level! Great service and atmosphere ! And the owner- Italian from Napoli such a nice person, who takes care of everything ðŸ˜ŠðŸ˜Š Best restaurant in Vietnam ðŸ‡»ðŸ‡³

We visited Luca Pizza & Italian Restaurant on a Wednesday night. Good we had a reservation because the place filled up quickly during our visit. They have a large menu with a variety of salads, pastas, pizzas, and desserts, along with some "daily specials."

We opted for two different pizzas: a pepperoni/spicy salami and a vegetarian that we added added chicken and gorgonzola. The pizzas themselves were well-made, with a thin crust and crispy edges. However, both pizzas lacked flavor. The vegetarian option, a bit overloaded with toppings, and the topping being to chunky to be on a pizza. The salami pizza suffered the same fate taste wise, and we felt the pizza sauce was to anonymous. It could have benefited from a bolder flavor profile, perhaps with more garlic and oregano. The gorgonzola we added on the pizza also lacked flavor.

While the pizza delivery was a bit delayed (which didn't bother us initially or that we said anything about), the staff went above and beyond to make amends. They offered us a complimentary dessert - an absolutely delicious ice cream cake with nuts - and even discounted our bill.

Overall, Luca Pizza & Italian Restaurant wins points for its friendly and attentive service. The dessert was a real highlight. However, the pizza itself needs some improvement, particularly with the flavor of the sauce and the balance of toppings. With a few adjustments, this restaurant could be a great option for Italian food in Vung Tau.

Service: 10/10
Food (pizza): 7/10
Dessert: 10/10

We visited this restaurant two times and we are really satisfied.We tried pizzas, lasagne, brucceta, coffe,beer and pistaccio desert. Service was amazing. Everything was great.Thank you for experience :)
Well design restaurant, good food good staff, acceptable price range

We enjoy pizza, and bake it ourself at home on woodfired pizza. The pizza at Luca Pizza is the best I had in Vietnam. The dough is well riped and you can taste that. The deserts where amazing aswell. Will come back tomorrow!

Truly excellent dining. The steak was super, the  black spaghetti and salmon were soo tasty. Deserts were top. Service was impeccable. The mains were so good I finished before taking pics... Mmmmm clean plates..
Super nice place to eat pizza, spaghetti and other Italian food. We ordered also seafood platter that was very tasty. The staff is also very sweet and polite.
Simple decor but an extensive menu. Fast service by friendly waitresses who speak excellent English. The "quattro stagioni" pizza was tasty with adequate toppings.

I had a nice lunch here. It is a good place for those looking for a more European style eatery after checking out the local restaurants. Also the clientele seemed to be more international compared to other restaurants and the waiters took the order in English without any problems. I really enjoyed the food, but the prices might be higher than elsewhere.

We ate here twice during our short stay to Vung Tau and loved it. We had the penne alla vodka the first time and shared the spinach ravioli with butter and sage and a tropicana pizza the second time. All of which was great! Would recommend

If the restaurant is not run by a specialized Italian person, the restaurant will not work.

It is dramatic how in many restaurants and hotels in Vietnam, they lack specialized foreign staff.

Vietnamese people are not familiar with Italian culture and food, it is not their responsibility to take care of it, so they should learn to work with foreigners.

After 2 weeks in Vietnam I wanted something that wasn't seafood or soup so we tried this place out.  We started with the Bruschetta followed by a Pepperoni pizza.  Both were excellent.  I have not seen pizza done correctly in Vietnam until today.  I could seriously eat it every day.  All told the pizza, bruschetta, 3 cokes and a coconut water was 360,000 VND, roughly $15 US.  Well worth taking the time to visit.  Service was great as well.  Highly recommend.

The pizza here slaps. I came to Vung Tau just to eat it. The service staff is friendly and efficient. Overall it's an excellent experience and exactly what I want from dining out or getting takeout. I will always look forward to my next visit.

Somewhat a fine dining experience. Their pizza is fresh and delicious. Pizzas aside, lasagna and some other foods are also worth a try, we ordered like 5 different dishes and all of them are very good.
One of a few authentic Italian restaurants in town. It's not so crowded even at weekend. I would recommend this place if you are looking for a cozy place with decent food.

Amazing food - the best pasta I have ever eaten - who knew this secret of Vietnam!
The serving staff were absolutely wonderful - attentive and friendly - highly highly recommend!!

Truly one of the TOP restaurants in Vung Tau imho. If you took away the mosquitos, definitely a 5 star experience. The bread basket we received with our seafood soup was cold (we ordered more ciabatta and it was hot and crunchy, still chewy from being freshly cut. The soup was loaded with calamari, shrimp, and clams with generous amount of olives. Pizza crust is soft and chewy with a nice char for the smoky flavor. Squid ink pasta with salmon was divine, creamy... with the saltiness from grated parmesan making this our favorite dish. Overall a great experience with superb customer service.

I ordered a takeaway pizza with a bottle of red, communication through whatsapp with the restaurant. And it was speedy response and delivery.

The pizza was so full of anchovies and super tasty. We added onions and spicy salami to it and my partner and I love it. I love my anchovies in italian pasta and pizza and find it hard to get a good puttanesca and pizza with anchovies in it, in Asia. Luca does it so well and the pizza was devoured fast. Super yummy. Highly recommended!! ðŸ˜†

And we also got a bottle of Italian sangiovese which went superbly well with the pizza. Awesome possum!!
ðŸ˜„
Food arrived at a good pace and the chef knows how a carbonara should be made (no cream). Will be coming again

On a rainy night in Vung Tau, we visited Luca's. Greated by the owner and escorted to our seats. Staff were very happy and attentive. Food BEST PIZZA IVE HAD IN VIETNAM. My pizza was the diavola extra pepperni. Amazing. My gf also had a great with zuppa Di pecci dinner. The cocktails were great and cheap. Highly recommend for anything Italian in Vung Tau, and we will be back. Thanks Andy oh try the dessert menu too

The BEST pizza we have had on our travels through Vietnam and other areas of Asia. The pasta was top notch and lovely Italian wine.You can tell it's authentic Italian right down to the service. The location overlooking the pond was a nice touch too. Highly recommend

We have good time being here and enjoy the food. Delicious and nice atmosphere. Good point about the restaurant didnâ€™t charge you any fee for paying by credit card, almost places in vung Tau will charge 3%
Atmosphere and service was ok. The taste  of the pizza was fine. However, the crust was burnt and black.

2 adults & 3 kids (11 yo, 11 yo & 14 yo) found delicious food for themselves in the middle of Vietnam!!!ðŸ’¯ Brilliant âœ¨ service, amazing ðŸ¤¯ Italian food, and tasty ðŸ˜‹ drinks. Originally we are from Krakow, Poland where Italian cuisine is strong. We also visited Italy multiple times, and check for yourself how good this place is ðŸ‘Œ and just to note it: good English.

Ordered their salmon pasta & house wine and Iâ€™m impressed!
The foodâ€™s super proper - they can cook the salmon perfectly so itâ€™s not overcooked.

The ambience is really nice - i recommend you sit on the 2nd floor which have a warm lighting decoration and is outdoor.

The price also great for such dish, i spent less than USD 10 for my pasta & wine.

Heard the pizzaâ€™s also legit - will come back to try it for sure!
My mum never finishes her food even if it's good and we would usually do a takeaway. Today marks a monumental moment, the food was excellent and the staffs were lovely! ðŸ’–ðŸŒ¿

Squid ink pasta with salmon was nice and light.

Pizza crust was great and light, however the sauce and toppings could be improved on

Overall, great restaurant to be at when in Vung Tau. Would be back again for sure.

The Pizza surprisingly tasts like in Italy! The pizza crust is thin like in italy, not american style! We were surprised how fast the food was served! Because of the excellent pizza we went for dessert and were astonished how delicious both Tiramisu and Choco Mousse was! Luca is an great place to escape asian food once you are tiredðŸ˜‰

Incredible proper Italian food in a place you'd least expect it. Service was great, didn't catch his name but the Italian server who greeted us and served our drinks was brilliant. Would go again. Reasonably priced for the level of service and quality of a western restaurant.

This Italian restaurant really has some amazing pizzas, the ingredients are fresh, the pizzas are a decent size and is accompanied by a crunchy, flavorful base, giving that authentic Italian feel. The prices are also very reasonable  , both the food and cocktails! I definitely recommend!
Luca's is still the best pizza in Vung Tau, bar none. However, service is still a bit slow and although the atmosphere is convivial it was a bit noisy with several tables of families with small kids.

I popped in this evening after a walk by the sea. I had the grilled vegetables with olive oil and herbs (ate it without taking pics) which were cooked perfectly. It was carrots, courgette (zucchini), aubergine (eggplant) tomatoes and onion. Was great. I followed it with the spinach ravioli with creamy ham and mushroom sauce. It was the perfect ratio of sauce to pasta. I enjoyed every bite, washed down with 2 glasses of white wine.
Good value for money (420k all in.)
Thank you ðŸ˜
Very amazing friendly customer service! They speak English very good. Food so delicious! Iâ€™m impressed. Thank youðŸ™ðŸ¾  I highly recommend to visit this place.
Delicious food. The personnel is very polite and speak very good English. Will definitely visit again.
One of the best pizza Iâ€™ve tried in Vietnam. Perfect flavor balance and even better dough. I was pleasantly surprised.

The food was great!! I fell in love with the pizza with squid on it!! The combo tasted a lot better than I expected. The flavors just eked so good together! I also had the carbonara pasta, and it tasted great, too, very creamy and flavorful! The prices were nice, as well. I had a wonderful time here with my cousins!
Authentic and perfect food, the lasagna, the Carbonara, the Caesar salad, and the spicy Diavola pizza are the best ones. Service is overall great.

Superb original Italian pizza, the dough is almost perfect, fluffy inside and well baked. They tomato sauce tastes fresh and flavorful. My only minor complaint is the cheese used, it would make everything perfect if they would use fresh mozzarella. But I understand that transport and cooling might be a problem. Also some fresh basil would be highly appreciated especially on the margherita. Nevertheless, since the dough makes the pizza certainly the best and most authentic pizza in Vung Tau. The location itself is nice too and the service very attentive and friendly. Prices are okay for the quality.
From US, this is the best pizza we have ever had! Great service and very friendly staff! We will definitely be coming back during our visit in Vang Tau!

The best Italian food in town.
The service is exceptional.
Good value.
Good italan food,maybe best in Vung tau.

Great food, but even better coffee â˜•ï¸ and cakes ðŸ°. For me best in south Vietnam so far. â™¥ï¸
Much recommended ðŸ™
Great pizza cooked the traditional Italian way.  Staff were excellent, attentive without being overbearing.
The staff was friendly and the food was delicious. Prices were reasonable. Will come back for more delicious foodðŸ•
Love the service vibes and food. Pizza and bread basket ðŸ§º were great. Finally had Arugula in Asia again ðŸ©µðŸŒ¼

Very good, decent place with reasonable prices. Though there are restaurants with better view, better interior, better furniture, maybe, this place is never a bad choice, and in fact it is the best combination of food, service and atmosphere. Because the owner values quality above all and is genuinely interested in making your experience as good as possible.
We all have different favorite food in my family but all of us - my kids, my Vietnamese husband and my mom - love this place. My son and I like lasagna, my daughter likes cavatelli tartufo, steak is great, too. Cold meat and cheese platter is good. And all of the pizzas are delicious!

As one of us had birthday that day, the owner insisted on a complimentary limoncello for both of us, it was very nice of him ! ðŸ˜Œ
Fresh & genuine Italian food, great pizza, very good quality-price ratio. Recommended

If you fancy for a proper Pizza, Luca is the place to go when you are in Vung Tau. It's probably the only place that you could try a Carbonara Pizza with eggs. Super yummy. The Tagliolini Neri Al Salmone, which is black homemade pasta (from squid ink) with salmon and cream source was absolutely the winner for me. A simple place with delicious food and friendly service. The Italian manager there is a great host.

It's was good food and service
Just improve your taste buds with the Italian Mediterranean cuisine.
The food was great, service excellent and all in all a great experience.

Was seated down stairs in a small air-conditioned room. Full of Mosquitoes. Moved upstairs where we had ordered our drinks waiting 30 minutes until served.  Followed by four slices of garlic bread served laying flat.on a white plate. Bizzare.! Waitress placed on opposite table from us.? Than received our pizza which was the house's special. Thinking nice N crisp.! Certainly wasn't. Half a dozen cherry tomatoes ðŸ… cut in half served with some rocket, Prosciutto. Everything slid off it like a slippery dip. Nothing was cooked including the pastry base.  Than told waitresses on two occasions we would like to pay and leave waited 15 minutes. Prior to going downstairs requesting again to pay so we could leave. Owner running around perspiring ðŸ˜“.  I was definitely hoping he wasn't going to be serving our food with beads of sweat dripping from him. Like he crawled out of the ocean in a wetsuit. The pizza tasted like Pita bread with salad placed on it. Sad state for the Italians if that's there best.ðŸ• â˜¹ï¸

Taste is delicious.
Price is reasonable.
Thank you ðŸ’for serving good food.
A very plaisant place with some very good foods. We have tested the raviolis with a bottle of Italian wine. A very nice evening
Pizza and calzone very enjoyable. Thank you for a nice dinner
So great italian restaurant in Vung Tau!! wine excellent, pizza wonderful, good staff ... don't hesitate !
Good hearty food. Friendly and attentive staff.   Nice clean and comfortable atmosphere
Great quality food. For someone who is a vegeterian there is decent options and tasty options available

We had a craving for Italian and this place was buzzing. Filled with loads of tourists! Very friendly place with welcome hellos as you enter. Service was fantastic and my husband's pizza was delicious, my spaghetti Bolognese though lacked seasoning flavour and taste really.

It is on the pricey side but the cocktails were great and we had a lovely evening sat upstairs. There is also a separate inside aircon area if you're too hot!
Friendly owner and staff. The owner is Italian himself. We loved loved loved the penne vodka!!! Will come back next time iâ€™m in town

The food was so good we didn't even have time to take photos. The service is quite fast and pizza was delicious. The staff is very friendly. If you ever happen to be in Vung Tau, give this place a try!

The pizza is really tasty and the dough is the best I've ever had eaten ðŸ¤Œ
For my family the large pizza was more like a regular size(Comparing to Pizza David). Overall, we enjoyed it for lunch, our complements for the chefsðŸ‘â£ï¸
Every dish was delicious ðŸ‘ that's the best pizza ever
good
Goid food and great service. Saporro beer notgood

My favourite eatery in Vung Tau. Whenever I visit I want to eat there. This time it was raining so I could not come but luckily  had the opportunity to order via Whatsapp message. I did it again enxt day.  As before, I got prompt and friendly communication in good English. Young lady brought my vegan pizza to my hotel in 20 minutes.  As always it was well made and price was very reasonable. Thank you!  Good pizaa and excellent service with a smile is so nice to get in Vietnam.   Thank you so much you professional, lovely people!
Great service  & pizza. One of the best I've had in Vietnam.
I'm from South Africa and I only eat food from Luca when I visit Vietnam.  The lasagne is absolutely delicious

Their pizzas were amazing and the prices are reasonable. We were 60 people, who walked in unannounced and they tackled the situation greatly. Few people had to wait a while but that seems fair taking the circumstances into consideration. Overall a great experience. Highly recommend.
Absolutely fine to dine out. Open air with a rooftop, good English speaking staff.
One of the best pizza places in Vung Tau no doubt.
The pizza, pasta, and salads were great.  The steak was good too, but they donâ€™t have steak sauce that I am used to with my steak.  The steak was a little bland without a good sauce.

Sophia was our waiter and it was like I sit not in vung tau vietnam! I sit in Italia with the brusceta that is very good and the pasta arabiata not from this world it was super delicious and wherever I get the offer italien food I would forever coming here back to luca!! Thanks to the chef that cook so good !!! Always recommend!!!

Italian restaurant with very complete menu including pizza. The food was good, and wine excellent. I most appreciated the friendly, attentive, and competent staff, and the elegant, comfortable spaces downstairs and up. I plan to come again.
I had very delicious ravioli here. Very nice Italian food â¤ï¸

After desperate attempts at Vietnamese so-called "pizza" restaurants, where you only get inedible, sweet mush made of dough with loads of corn and peas, we tried this place after a recommendation. And voila: the Italian owner actually makes an "Italian pizza" that really deserves its name. Just like you know and are used to in Europe. Clearly recommended!

Easily the best restaurant in the area! Clean, nice climate and atmosphere...I relax the moment I sit down. The staff are not only polite and helpful but are warm and welcoming and always smiling. Here youâ€™ll find Italian food at its best! For example, Pizza. This being my favorite food, I try it everywhere I go. Iâ€™ve been in 49 USA states, 18 countries and everywhere I go I try the pizza. The pizza here is my #1 favorite of ALL that Ive tried...#2 is from La GrillardiÃ¨re in Maroc. Last but not least, the beer. Ice cold Frosty mugs filled with San Miguel; it just doesnt get any better than this. This is easily a 5 star food, service and overall dining experience. Im on my way there now...
Really good pizza! Great dough and delicious toppings. Salads are fresh too. Pasta is good but if youâ€™re deciding between the two, Iâ€™d go for pizza!

We came for dinner after reading all the great reviews and I must say it did not disappoint one bit. The place is having a truly Italian vibes and definitely the best pizza we've had so far in Vietnam. The pizza was on par with some of the pizza we've had in London and Italy so you know the quality is great. The service was excellent! Everyone was so nice and attentive. I cannot recommend this place enough.

Everything about this place was lovely.  The people taking your order are just as sweet and kind as you can be.  The pizza is great.  I ordered a large and the cook came out, pulled out a fresh ball of dough, flattened it and cooked it right there for me.  It was I think the best pizza I've had in Vietnam.  The dough is done right.  It's fluffy and light but not soggy (the sauce is great and it's reduced enough that it doesn't get the dough soggy).  And if you're wondering why in the world would I not eat Vietnamese food or seafood (which I know is obviously the best choice) but I have 2 kids that only eat 4 things, 3 of which you can't find in Vietnam.  Pizza is it.  The price is good and the dining area is clean and very upbeat.  They also deliver to the nearby hotels but you really want to go by and say hi to the people that work there.  Except the chef.  He was the one person that I talked to there that seemed like he'd just come from a blackout drunk party.  But he can cook so I'll give him a pass.

Genuine Italien food, chef must have been living in Italy. Ingredients are of very high quality.
Very friendly staff! Great outdoor 1st floor seating.

Great Food, Great Service, Great Location
Craving a Great Pizza & A bottle of wine look no further

Couldn't help ourselves went back a second time during our stay at Vung Tau and again was not disappointed, got the same Great Food, Great Service.
Very nice the food yummy and very quick for serve

This is the second time I'm writing a review for this restaurant because I'm so impressed!
This eatery serves up tasty pizza with good service, friendly staff, a welcoming atmosphere, and reasonable prices. The pizza crust is a standoutâ€”I haven't had one this good in a while. Definitely worth a visit!

Best restaurant in Vung Tau, service is impeccable, the pizzas are easily the tastiest/best quality I have tasted worldwide. If you are staying in Vung Tau you must come here for pizza they are outstanding and very well priced. Do not miss it if in the area. The service manager speak good english and is the nicest guy. Come here if on your travels you will not be disappointed.
I great restaurant on the road that leads to the beach. I enjoyed the Margherita pizza, atmosphere and service.

Great pizza. They seem to follow the correct recipes and preparation procedures. Everything is tasty. Definitely recommended.

But the air conditioning barely works. I was covered in sweat after just 30 minutes there. The price is also quite high.

We came here 2 days in row.
First day we ordered salmon pasta and bechamel sauce pizza.
Pasta was great, salmon was fresh and soft. Bechamel Pizza was a little bit bland, wish ham was a bit more salty.
Second day we ordered tuna pizza and risotto.
Tuna brought more flavor on pizza and was good. However risotto was underwhelming.
Staff seem well trained and friendly.
Overall it was a good place.

We've eaten at Ristorante Luca several times, both for lunch and dinner.

Very good food, excellent service, and excellent prices.

Authentic Italian food.

I highly recommend this restaurant.

For my taste, food quality werenâ€™t matched with the prices. Could have been better. Tiramisu was the worst dish, too sweet, soft (not sure that they used ladyfingers, but if they do then itâ€™s consistency was too strange), pasta was okay.
Amazing food taste, I didnâ€™t expect how good it is. My family was enjoyed it a lot. Service is good too. You guy can find a delicious italian food at Luca. 100% recommended.

Excepting pizza, the food is perfectly cooked according to my taste ðŸ‘… The pizzaâ€™s crust is a little bit dry so I am not really into it. The price is neutrally appropriate, not expensive as I expect for that such atmosphere and the meal I ordered.

The server is so friendly and so do the boss. The space is airy and the location is easy to find, which is suitable for having a freaking chilling dinner eating and chatting with buddies or family. Recommending every guests to come!!!!

The pizza is good, but other parts of the menu are weak. Iâ€™d recommend just ordering pizza and drinks. Donâ€™t order the stir-fried chicken with lemongrass. It came out drenched in oil and was terrible. Focus on the good stuff.

Great place, highly recommended. I went here twice, which I very, very rarely do when traveling.
It's a nice location, with outdoor rooftop terrace seating and indoor ac space. The staff, including the boss/owner (?) are very friendly and competent.
The food is delicious: I had chicken with cheese and ham on my first visit and a pizza the second time. The pizza had a nice thin crust, generous toppings and was yummy! They have nice appetizers, desserts and a reasonably priced wine list as well! And you can pay by card, too.
We love the food and ate here many times during our stay. It never disappoints and is very affordable! If you want to eat proper Italian food, look no further! We will come back next year.

Coming from New York, I was in search of a good standard pepperoni pizza, it was very delicious and definitely similar to pizza back home. It was also spicy which I enjoyed. Worth the $6 for sure. I would like to try the lasagna next time :) I knew the food and service was going to be good when the worker was singing along to the music playing in the background ðŸ¤£

Discovered this place on the second last day in Vietnam and wish weâ€™d discovered this sooner. So far weâ€™ve had Italian at multiple places and this was by far the best, in terms of service, taste and pricing. Their pizza was even better than what we had at 4Ps in Ho Chi Minh City. The Desserts and cocktails were outstanding too. Highly, highly recommend this place.
Pizza was very good, I was not so impressed with the seafood fried rice. We needed to ask for soy sauce, it was not given automatically. In general a good experience
Pizza smells great, the crust was crunchy and the dough was thin. Nice place to have Pizza.

Very good Pizzas! Gor surprised with the taste of 4 cheeses and Margherita, probably the best ðŸ• I tried in Vung Tau.
The restaurant is right next to the lake which is very chilly in the evening. Plenty of foreigners have dinner here.

First time to dine at the Alex, great service backed up with superb foods and flavours. A bit of a hidden location of Leloi but well worth it. My wife and I shared the borsch soup, cabbage rolls and the salmon potatoe pancakes all were outstanding. In all a wonderfull experience!
It is a very unique Russian restaurant in Vung Tau, all the food we got was great

Truly amazing all around. We werenâ€™t super familiar with Russian food being from California and this was sooo good.

Great service, the waiter was lovely and very proud of the food so he helped us pick a great meal.

The hashbrowns were next-level - so crispy and flavorful (we got the mush room and cheese). The Borsch was fantastic (the waiter taught us how to have with a shot of vodka to cleanse the palette - delightful). The chicken was perfectly cooked (and we are picky because so often skewers are dry and not good).

As a bonus, the music selection was great, very cool and hip decor.

5 stars, would recommend!

It was a quiet Saturday afternoon. We arrived after 130pm to eat so there wasnâ€™t too many other people. The service was professional and attentive, the place was as casual as it gets but not uncomfortable. The menu was just wide enough for a spot like this. We had the hash brown and skewers, both were really delicious. We enjoyed ourselves. Definitely looking forward to coming back again.

wow this is the best russian restaurant i have ever been to! tastes like at home. prices are cheap and the portions are super big!!! the waiter even spoke Russian
i wish i could eat here every day but i live in hcm

Such a gem of a Russian restaurant in VÅ©ng TÃ u! The skumbria with potatoes is absolutely delicious perfectly marinated and full of flavor. The chicken kabobs were also amazing: juicy, tender, and grilled just right. I miss home and home food so this restaurant is just a perfect solution for those extra hard days of nostalgia!
Russia food? Come on, this is absolutely tasty and healthy, good atmosphere, good music, buckwheat stew is so good with chicken, highly recommended ðŸ¥³

Good restaurant if you want to eat Russian cuisine)
Good and cute staff ðŸ‘Œ

Incredible food. The pork schnitzel and stuffed pepper were fantastic. Service was a bit slow, but understandable due to the holiday and how busy it was. Comfortable atmosphere, although very outdated. Seems quite popular among foreigners. Prices were reasonable.

However, even though I enjoyed the food, after reading the review from an employee there, I don't think I will be returning.
Delicious Russian food for a reasonable price. Kind staff members and great service.

I want to leave a review about this cafe after working there for some time, I canâ€™t call it a restaurant and there are several reasons for this. the first and most important thing is food. If you can somehow close your eyes to the cleaning staff preparing food (although it looks very creepy), itâ€™s difficult to close your eyes to rat droppings in spices. Of course, the cuisine in this cafe is rich and varied, but the preparation of this food leaves much to be desired. The only thing I can recommend is BBQ, because itâ€™s not cooked in the kitchen, but on a grill outside, thatâ€™s what I can recommend taking there. Also, prepare to meet the two-faced management of this restaurant, who will hate you fiercely if you order delivery for less than 200k dong. What struck me more was when the good chefs left and, unfortunately, no new chefs came, then one of the managers began to cook alone in the kitchen, for this, of course, you can respect a person, he cooks alone, etc., but for about a week and a half this man was very sick and after preparing the food, she went out into the hall, smoked, talked to everyone and said that she was very sick and was cooking alone in the kitchen, after such words, as a guest, I would not come to this restaurant at all. The atmosphere in this cafe is in the style of the 90s, where it seems to me that the management of the cafe is from. I would highly not recommend this cafe, only if for delivery, I would not want to eat in the cafe itself, only if you order BBQ. I will continue my review if management somehow threatens me after this review, but I think a couple of such notes are enough for now to understand the integrity of this cafe. The rating for this cafe is 1/5, one only because You can't give zero stars here. good luck everyone and bon appetit!)
Takeaway food was delicious! Big portions, high quality ingredients, good quality meat and ingredients! This would be my go to restaurant

- The food is good but in small portions. I had to order two main dishes for a meal
- Service was very slow. The cooks really took their time in the kitchen and let us wait for half an hour for our food. They served people who came later before the early coming customers.
- You should point at the menu when you order because they only speak russian.
- Handmade drinks are mediocre. They don't have typical russian drinks.
Great food. I mean really good food. A bit slow service. Not beachfront location ðŸ˜… Go there for the food, you won't regret it.

The best food in the town! We ate a lot there cause everything was so tasty. I had a sense that Iâ€™m back to Russia after the first meal -beef stroganoff (advice - itâ€™s better to order for this dish some black bread because beef stroganoff has amazing sauce). Also the atmosphere is nice, very friendly staff working there. The waiter Michael was very friendly and helpful. We ordered beef stroganoff, pasta carbonara, chicken in sauce with fried potatoes, salad woth fish (seledka pod shuboi), homemade alcohol and tea. Everything was great! Highly recommend, weâ€™ll definitely come back
Fantastic food, great drinks, lovely place, friendly owner and staff. Try his special vodkas. Definitely worth a visit.

Nice place to have a meal in Vung Tau. If you like European cousins (Russian or Ukrainian) this place you definitely should visit. Very delicious ðŸ˜‹, portions are very large, reasonable prices. Very friendly staff. Michael, you are awesome ðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘ðŸ‘
Nice place, great food, huge portions, attentive stuff. The only thing I didn't like smoking people, smoking should not be allowed inside the restaurants.
The food here is very good , went there twice had the beet soups both times it was excellent. And the cottage cheese  strawberry dumplings, they were excellent as well, well worth trying.

Must Visit!
Big portions , cheap price and incredibly delicious
The food is good and the portions are really generous. The staff is also very friendly. One of the best Russian restaurants in Vietnam.
Lovely Russian place, was happy to eat home food we're used to. Nice owners, great waiter Mikhail. The food is very delicious and the portions are quite big.
amazing russian cuisine experience
Authentic, homelike food. Huge selection of food. Must try fulfilling Crepes. Tasty food and amazing fast service. I like music selection as well.

Excellent, high quality, delicious foods.
Friendly  English speaking staff.
Clean cozy atmosphere.
Good prices.
The food was okay, not bad at all. But my friend got sick from it and were half of the night on the toilet. The Service was still great.
Beautiful place, nice food, wonderful people ðŸ˜Š recommend to anyone ðŸ˜„ by the way, the best place for barbecue in Vung Tau!
Great food highly recommend
The food tasted so good. I love beverage too.
delicious, eaten many times
Very tasty food!
Delicious russian cousine in a cozy environment, reasonably priced. 5 stars â¤ï¸
Great place with amazing food and atmosphere.

Just love the place.
Very good food
Very friendly, great atmosphere, and yummy pizzas.
Certainly best food in Vung tau!
Good food and good restaurant!
Nice place with a good food and nice music
Amazing good job
Delicious food for reasonable price

I had a great dinner at Alex. The Vietnamese staff was cheerful and gave enthusiastic advice, and the Russian owner was also very friendly. The food was delicious, especially the sour cream salmon crepe which was surprisingly delicious, and the thickly sliced â€‹â€‹but juicy grilled meat which was very delicious. The salad was also fatty enough not to be greasy. The mushroom soup was quite rich and fatty. 2 people ordered 3 dishes and it was enough to be full. If I have the opportunity to go to VT, I will come back to the restaurant many more times.

Russian Alex here. Of well over a dozen inspected Russian restaurants all over Southeast Asia, this is the best one, and by far.   REAL Russian chef and cooks!

The food is good, some dishes are excellent. The prices are very nice - surprisingly nice for the size of the portions. Having experienced many Russian restaurants in SEA countries, I expected the portions to be very small for the indicated price - I ordered way too many dishes for 2 people, we almost exploded. Don't repeat my mistake. Every single dish here is enough to get filled.

Personal recommendations: Pork Shashlyk, Pork Zraza (it's giant!!), Solyanka was OK.

Very friendly staff.

Highly recommended for checking this place out!

ðŸ‡·ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡·ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡·ðŸ‡º

Gentlemen, the music in the establishment is terrible. The food felt like a lump in my throat from some of the songs. I understand that nostalgia and homesickness manifest differently in everyone, but think about your guests. After all, you can turn on something modern and good, fortunately there is a lot of that now, and not "good radio". All my nostalgia and melancholy evaporated from your music.

And the swearing that regularly came from the kitchen also hit my ears.

The waiter was wonderful!

Thank you for the dinner, everything was delicious!

Cozy space, open space with fans, mostly foreign guests (Russian-speaking). Food comes out quickly, tastes good, drinks are delicious (in the picture is Sangria), the staff is friendly and cute. I will come back and introduce to many others.

The food is delicious. The prices on the menu look a bit high compared to the average local dishes, but the amount of food is a lot, I think it's suitable for foreigners' appetite (there are quite a lot of Russians). I ordered 3 dishes, the total bill was 350k for 2 people, but I was so full that I had to take some home ðŸ¥² The taste is pleasant, only the sour sauce/cheese sauce can be a bit difficult for the elderly to eat, but young people can do it freely hehe. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The speed of serving dishes is fast (I went around 2pm) and the food is hot and freshly cooked. The restaurant space is spacious and airy. Quiet and only has Russian music ðŸ«¶ðŸ»
We tried kvass, syrniki, solyanka, pancakes with red fish and sandwiches with sprats - everything was delicious and well prepared.

Everyone, please pay attention to the portion size here, because it is MUCH more shocking than the price. The way of eating in Saigon, but when I came here, I ordered 5 people to eat at once and I almost suffocated. If only the restaurant had advised on the portion size earlier, there wouldn't have been a scene of 5 people ordering 8 main dishes and being so full. The food is really delicious, the first time I tried Russian food and I loved it!

We had okroshka, shish kebab, cheesecakes, julienne pancake - everything was very tasty! You'll lick your fingers) The service is great too!
I donâ€™t recommend pancakes with cheese and ham, the ham is terrible (

It's wonderful that we have our own ALEX restaurant in Vung Tau!
And it's great that they deliver their delicious dishes!
The wings are finger-licking good, the Caesar salad with crevitas is a culinary orgasm!!

A huge thank you to you, our breadwinners!!!

The food is delicious. The interior of the establishment is a la 2010 (Vietnamese style for some reason, although the cuisine is predominantly European). I asked for a glass of water, but there is only paid water. The owner was rude and sent me away. The owner responds rudely to any complaint. This is definitely not a restaurant, just an ordinary eatery with exorbitant prices. There is something to compare it to. I do not recommend it.

If we're going to have a good time, let's have a good time!
Well, where else but in a Russian restaurant can we have a feast for the stomach!!)
Caesar with chicken, pancakes, Brownie for dessert...
And there were also giant potato pancakes with salmon - a flight to the highest levels of pleasure!!!
I recommend Alex for dinner with family and friends if you miss Russian cuisine ðŸ˜ŽðŸ‘

Super!!! The portions are huge and everything is very tasty. Real Russian cuisine. We ordered three dishes for two: Olivier, pelmeni and cheburek. We ate until we were full. The portions are 300 or 400 grams. We wanted to try half the menu.
Amazingly delicious and cheap food. Highly recommend pickled vegetables, grilled meat skewers, salmon pancakes, dumplings, and soup. The staff are also cute and enthusiastic. Beautiful space, 10/10
I highly recommend visiting this establishment. Friendly staff, very tasty food. I especially recommend trying the "zraza stuffed with cheese"

If you sell syrniki for 600 rubles, have the conscience to at least fry them properly, and not put burnt syrniki in the order. Everyone makes mistakes, but in normal places they will remake the dish and will not put burnt syrniki in the order
I didn't like the taste either

Great place!!! Delicious food, large portions â€“ great value for money!
They immediately changed my wrong order, and they accommodated my drink requests. 10/10

We've ordered takeout several times. Everything is always delicious! Delivery is on time. Great prices and large portions! My sister recommended this restaurant; she often orders delivery for the whole family. I especially recommend trying the julienne pancakes, bacon-wrapped chicken livers, tender salmon salad, pork shashlik, and tom yum soup!ðŸ”¥

The beetroot salad I ate was quite delicious - a harmonious combination of sweet and salty. The fried pork is also quite greasy. The last dish is a pancake with a slightly runny sauce (I guess yogurt), and the meat filling is a bit salty compared to the shell. The price is quite cheap for a meal.  High ceiling, large space
Excellent Russian cuisine with huge portions, a great waiter greeted us with a pleasant compliment. Cheese croutons and pancakes were very tasty. I recommend! ðŸ˜‰

Solyanka is excellent
Fried potatoes ðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥
Dumplings are delicious, just like mom's. Service is excellent.

A wonderful cafe with Russian cuisine, large portions, fantastically tasty shish kebab, but the interior is long outdated, itâ€™s time to renovate, give the cooks a chefâ€™s jacket and it will look decent, the appearance of the cooks now does not inspire confidence, stretched home T-shirts look a little homeless.

This is an authentic Russian restaurant.
It's an open-air restaurant, so it might be best to avoid it on hot days.
All the dishes are hearty and not bad in taste. I don't know the real taste, so I can't say if it's Russian cuisine or not.
The salmon crepe was especially delicious. The spare ribs were a little less sweet than others and a little dry, but I personally liked the taste. There are several restaurants in Vung Tau that serve borsch, but this is my favorite.
The prices are reasonable, so you can easily try a variety of dishes.
The service is not very polite, but you can feel the kindness.
Liqueurs such as whiskey are also cheap, so it might be a good opportunity to drink alcohol.

Truly Russian, everyone! Anyone who wants to try Russian cuisine should come here. The menu is diverse, the portions are large. Everyone should try the soups, beetroot salad, sweet or savory pancakes and grilled meat skewers.
The waiter was very friendly. The food was delicious and the restaurant was clean.

We ordered 4 typical Russian dishes: very delicious, strange and manyâ€¦.
Russian chef, processing, spices... completely Russian
Good price; Delicious quality;
Friendly, enthusiastic and cheerful staff. Detailed instructions for guests
Excellent Russian cuisine. Russian cooks. All dishes are very large and tasty. I recommend.
Xin Chao, let's give it a rating! The hamburger ðŸ” 3.0. The meat wasn't smelly, and the bun was passable for Vung Tau. It's head and shoulders above the other restaurants.

Yesterday I was in this establishment.

Very tasty shashlik and solyanka, the staff works quickly and politely. I got great pleasure from visiting this establishment.

And I saw with what love the owner (she is Russian) manages the staff and wants to help and so that each client is well-fed and happy. This is worth a lot. Where both taste and attitude are at the highest level.

I rarely leave comments and reviews.
But here I decided and will say, addressing the owner of the establishment:

"Dear owner of this establishment. Unfortunately, I do not know your name. You are a sorceress and a caring manager. Your clients will always be with you, do not worry about anything. Your love for clients and staff is felt. And from this there will be even more people and clients. I have not seen this for a long time. I can say for sure that you are a sorceress from God and a fairy of the culinary craft. Thank you."

If I could give 100 points, I would give 150.

Thank you. Sincerely, Vyacheslav Vedernikov.
Excellent cozy restaurant of Russian cuisine. The food is excellent, the portions are good, the price is decent. We have been with the family many times - we liked everything very much.
Great crispy cheburek and kvass.

Russian food restaurant cooked by Russians. The owner is a very cute Russian family.
The food has a real Russian flavor (I studied in Russia for 5 years so I know), the menu is diverse, and the dishes don't take too long to come out.
You should try it everyone
Excellent restaurant!!! I am delighted! They even have things that are not on the menu)), as long as the customer is happy! Excellent steaks, tea with pancakes and various toppings...

I ordered Caesar with salmon, dumplings and pancakes at Alex @ALEXRestaurant - the food is simply cosmos. Very tasty, large portions, nice place. I also took delivery - quickly, the portions were just as big and tasty. Thank you very much ðŸ‘ðŸ»ðŸ‘ðŸ»ðŸ‘ðŸ»
Great place! The last negative reviews were due to conflicts of interest. Ivan Agapov previously worked at this restaurant! And he did a pretty low thing by writing such reviews.
The staff speaks Russian. We ordered delicious pelmeni, sandwiches with sprats and buckwheat with liver (where else in a restaurant can you order a buckwheat dish)? A very good place, made with love.
nice interior and very tasty food ðŸ˜Œ

Excellent restaurant of Russian cuisine! Very tasty, huge portions, reasonable prices. Exceptionally friendly and hospitable staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and will definitely come back again!
Great for all those who are used to eating delicious soups and European cuisine, this is the place for you.
Very tasty traditional European food, large portions, own ingredients for dishes, no semi-finished products! I highly recommend borscht and potato pancakes with sour cream!!!
Good attentive service, clean and airy space, reasonable price
This is an island of Russian cuisine in Vietnam. Very tasty and huge portions - be careful when ordering)))
The new menu is cool
I liked everything sooooo much and the food was awesomeðŸ˜
Everything is very tasty, there are even dumplings
Delicious food, the waiter is very sociable but unobtrusive, kvass is a pushka
Delicious! We always order shashlik and salads.
Delicious :)
If it's Russian food, you shouldn't eat at this restaurant.
Nice restaurant interior, attentive service and simply huge portionsðŸ‘
The food is delicious, the portions are large.
A warm place, great cuisine. I'll definitely come again)
New favorite place in Vung Tau â¤ï¸
Warm! Soulful! Delicious!
delicious
This place sells Russian food.
Wonderful place! Delicious foodâ˜ºï¸
Delicious food, warm-hearted hostsâ¤ï¸
Very good place, I recommend it.

First time to dine at the Alex, great service backed up with superb foods and flavours. A bit of a hidden location of Leloi but well worth it. My wife and I shared the borsch soup, cabbage rolls and the salmon potatoe pancakes all were outstanding. In all a wonderfull experience!
It is a very unique Russian restaurant in Vung Tau, all the food we got was great

Amazing place for the good steak and cocktails. You can spend here hours enjoying your time. Also got cheese plate. It was very good quality.
Totally recommended and very friendly!

It was a mix of feelings, much like the place itself. Was it French, Spanish, or American? The menu featured seafood paella, burgers, American-style dÃ©cor, and even duck confit. The beef patty was cooked to the wrong temperature, and when we sent it back, the buns were simply re-toasted instead of preparing a fresh burger. From a decent restaurant, I would have expected a properly cooked, brand-new burger instead.
The service staff was good, 5 stars , but the kitchen hands had much room for improvement.

*. I requested a medium-cooked patty, but it arrived closer to medium-rare, with blood oozing out and soaking the patty. When I sent it back to be corrected, it returned overcooked, with hardened buns.

After more than 2 years I returned to my once favourite restaurant in Vung Tau ... and it's even better! New central location, with a great atmosphere, complimented by excellent food at absurdly reasonable prices. Local tip, finish your meal off with a glass of Cupito!
I gave four stars on the food as my Chicken Cordon Bleu was a little overdone, but mussels from NZ in cream sauce were heavenly as an appetiser.

A nice western restaurants with seemingly many foreign regulars. The waiter is professional and the service is great so that it feels like a fine restaurant. I came in thinking about getting their pasta, but the waiter told me their main thing is the fish and meat, so I changed my mind and got pan fried sea bass. They have todayâ€™s special menu, so I picked one from there as well. I have had better sea bass dish in this country, but the portion is pretty big here, so I think itâ€™s a good value. The ravioli had foie gras in it and that was pretty good, but their cheese cake is like a hard cheese cake that makes you thirsty, so that was not really my thing. The main chef here is French and this is a pretty nice good western restaurant overall.

The food and wine was good. The amount for the price is small, and it was a bit undercooked. We made a reservation ahead of time, but the staff weren't prepared at all when we arrived. Service was extremely slow. I understand that Sunday can be busy, but it should be something that the restaurant is prepared for. Other customers ordered after us and received food before us, so it's possible that our order was originally forgotten. Overall, for the price, there are better options available.

Went for afternoon lunch with my family. Very good service. Our waitress was fast and very attentive.
The food was magnificent.  We ordered from across the menu to get the maximum flavour profile. The portions were very generous and the flavours were spot on.
Thank you, a lovely experience.

The food was the damn good. European style. Absolutely delicious! The service wasn't perfect, but wasn't bad either. The atmosphere ainâ€™t bad. Wait till after sundown and get a table upstairsâ€¦.very nice. Given what they had to work with, I don't think I could offer any suggestions to improve the atmosphere. The kitchen appeared the most professional kitchen I've seen in Vietnam. There were 4 or so 'Chef's', and they were using a variety of pots/ bowls will preparing orders. Also stove tops and oven. It sure appeared to me that detail was of great priority. The dish presentation was flawless. AND EVER DISH WAS SERVED AT THE SAME TIME. Scattered dish arrival is so common in Vietnam, and this restaurant allowed the whole table to enjoy a fabulous meal together. We had a party of 4 and every thing set on table was enjoyed, nothing left, and no hunger after the meal....decent portion size! I'm planning another trip to this city for the expressed desire to eat there again.
And I have returned. Took a ferry from HCMC for the expressed desire for another meal. LOVED it. Worth it. I do not hesitate to recommend this joint. Have dinner here, I doubt youâ€™ll be disappointed.
Plan on leaving a tip here.

This is the 3rd time we've been here and each time we have left super happy. The food and service is fantastic. Big up to our waitress who not only remembered us but was also super attentive. The owner is kind and generous. The price is absolutely correct for the quality and we are really happy that this is the representation of French / Basque culture in Vietnam. Bravo ðŸ‘

The food was truly delicious . As a lover of French cuisine, I was slightly disappointed by the absence of a warm baguette and butter, a classic combination. While the restaurant did charge an extra 5,000 VND for butter, it was a small price to pay for such a delicious meal.

The green salad was a standout, with perfectly balanced flavors. The pork belly confit was simply divine, and the accompanying sauce elevated the dish to new heights.

The restaurant's ambiance is elegant and inviting, making it an ideal spot for a romantic dinner. The wine list and dessert menu were equally impressive. Our waiter was exceptionally attentive and provided excellent service. I'm eager to return and explore the rest of the menu.

Another good review to add to all the previous. I now understand why so many people love this place. I had a great dinner of good food, warm service, and a comfortable atmosphere. Small touches like cloth napkins can sometimes go a long way, especially if you're looking to have a more special meal. Appreciated that they have multiple options for wine by-the-glass. As a solo diner, I felt very taken care of by the staff, all of whom were friendly.

Excellent French restaurant.
Delicious food & drink.
The owner of the restaurant is from France,
The food is very authentic.
Thanks for the hospitality.

ðŸ˜‹ðŸ˜‹ðŸ˜‹ We are French and felt like home in this cozy restaurant. We felt welcomed right the way with the warm bread and butter just like in France. The French style burger and homemade fries tasted like comfort food. The duck breast (magret) and mashed pumpkin were so smooth and suave. Both duck and beef patty were cooked just like we asked. Servings were nice. We had the salted caramel buttery crepe (which is a staple in our house ðŸ‡«ðŸ‡·) and the chocolate ganache crepe. I requested a change in ice cream flavor and it was even better. The entire staff and owner are super sweet and professional. There are so many interesting dishes on the menu, we canâ€™t wait to come back. ðŸ’¯ðŸ’¯ðŸ‘ðŸ‘

A glass of Red Wine? Is it a good place for Valentine?
A good restaurant in the city, romantic atmosphere, good service.. Donâ€™t know why this place is not busy at all time ðŸ˜„
Pork: soft, good with the sauce
Mashed potatoes: probably one of my favorite dish ðŸ‘
Just imagine of dating someone here is surely deserve a visit ðŸ¥³

I recently dined at DONQUIJOTE restaurant and was blown away by the delicious food and impeccable service. The warm and inviting atmosphere as soon as you step inside really sets the tone for a wonderful dining experience. The menu features a range of dishes that showcase the chef's creativity and passion for French cuisine, with something to satisfy every palate. I particularly enjoyed the perfectly cooked steak and delicate seafood dishes. Although prices were slightly higher than before, the quality of the food and service was definitely worth the investment. Overall, I highly recommend DONQUIJOTE restaurant to anyone who appreciates French cuisine and wants to indulge in a memorable dining experience.

Good restaurant with nice trained staff. The tuna tartare is amazingly fresh and red, the pasta was good and the crepe with salted butter caramel was delicious, not too sweet. They even let us try a taster of draught beer for free. Only deception is the free bread that is just average.
Really recommend for Don Quijote restaurant, I had a wonderful birthday celebration with my girl friend. Everything here is great with best service!
Perfect place.  Steak is one of the best in Vung Tau. Very good and gentle personal.

Itâ€™s the only place we as a group came to in Vietnam where we could eat and eat and eat! Food is delicious, service is fantastic, portions are perfect size. Get yourself a starter main dessert with a cocktail and youâ€™ll wish for seconds. Superb

I like Vietnamese food, don't let that dilute this review. As my wife and I noted, we'd like a change of menu every now and then. This was a brilliant and welcoming visit. We booked, but it wasn't really needed. Note that the phone number on facebook is the correct one. The restaurant is spacious, clean and well dressed. Staff is welcoming, friendly and attentive. Food is very much what it promises to be; very tasty, European, chef's standards and well presented. I could've easily spend a whole evening here.
Do note that the prices reflect the exclusivity but are still very reasonable.

Thank you for making our anniversary one to remember, positively.

Good food. Good seating. The restaurant opens quite late at 11. The offerings are decent, limited but great quality. I wished they had breakfast selection.
Tried their burger, itâ€™s nice. Service is decent. And seating  is great.
A gem in Vung Tau. Do visit

Tan, our waitress, was amazing.
The food was super. Watch out as the â€˜mediumâ€™ lamb chops were quite pink for us. Maybe just us
The layout of the tables needs attention. Especially upstairs as the atmostspbere is a bit boring
Luckily the food makes up for it

Foreign food served in a pleasant, clean environment with English menu and service. I enjoyed the Serrano ham platter entrÃ©e and my colleague and I enjoyed our main dishes of tagliatelle and roast chicken. We also had a chicken salad and I was happy to see that there was plenty of chicken included. Desserts are also available, along with alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. Although not cheap by local standards, the price was certainly reasonable for this kind of restaurant. The restaurant is not big, so service was fast and professional, and the place was very clean. At the end of our meal, a nice touch was a shot of strong liquor of the restaurant's own recipe (tasted great) and the chef was good enough to ask after the quality of our food and see us out. If in Vung Tau and after a western meal, then you should look up this place as one possible option!

I have visited this restaurant many times for 3 years but this time is quite disappointing because of decorating and planting of meal.

As photo, is this really your best? I've never seen this kind of decorating for pasta before in any restaurant. Makes my appetite lose enough.

Delicious!!! â¤ï¸
I had the pork chop and veg which was absolutely divine and we also had the duck breast which was so tender and so delicious! We also had the calamari starter with an amazing sauce
The waiting time was a bit long but so so worth it!
We will definitely be back for more!

Lovely dinning place. Really good western place. Flavourful. I have never thought to find such a place in Vung Tau. Really recommend.

I have shrimp ravioli and my husband has seabass. Absolutely delicious!

Just had two glasses of bordeaux,  a shrimp and chorizo appetizer and the beef bourguignon with the best mash potatoes I have ever eaten.  The hospitality was tremendous and the atmosphere was extremely pleasant.  I anticipate eating many meals here in the future.
everything is perfect, delicious food, best restaurant in Vung Tau
This is a really nice place to go very quiet beautiful music really nice people who take really good care of you and the food is excellent

Overal I had a slightly disappointing experience tonight at this highly rated restaurant.

To summarise: We ordered patatas bravas for starters - potatoes not crispy & served with a very basic garlic mayo. Bread brought later, no olive oil (or butter) on tables.

Mains: I ordered rib-eye steak & asked for medium, I believe they served me the rib eye by mistake & 75% of steak was well done (very uneven cooking overall as parts were still rare). After querying steak there was a simple apology from the waitress, at the end of the meal I spoke to the manager & he showed me the 2 cuts of steak, after looking iI truly believe that I was served a striploin (well-done) by mistake. Despite this I was charged for the ribeye (Iâ€™ve prepare ribeye many times before & the steak was too thin to be this cut I think). I ordered the pepper sauce to go with it & it just tasted like gravy with peppercorns added, there was no strong pepper taste, it seemed a bit rushed. The steak tasted good but I felt let down by the whole experience especially after noone (including the owner who was informed) followed up with my complaint effectively even though I had politely raised the issue several times.
Many kind of steak are available in this restaurant. I odered each different steaks, beef and chicken are recommended. Drafted beer also good. But little bit costly.

So the missus and I decided to give this place a go after reading quite a number of glowing reviews here, but also to take a wee break from vietnamese cuisine.

I'm not going to be brutal and harsh nor sound like an elitist a**hole, but I only want to be honest with our experience here- which was surprisingly underwhelming.

The seafood paella was lacking in flavour to the point where I had to constantly sprinkle copious amount of salt and pepper, which is rather out of character of me. The rice was soggy and the base was wet, staggeringly unusual considering that the paella is Spain's national dish, so getting this quite off is... perplexing. I'm no chef but I reckon what it really needs is perhaps more paprika, safron/sofrito and a more robust broth to elevate this dish.

Gambas was barely passable, however, what would probably help is searing the prawns beforehand. The accompanying sauce base is decentt but quite weak. The baked pieces of croutons(?) helped, but it probably needs more garlic, olive oil and paprika overall.

Finally the lamb chops. Though cooked just right at medium rare, a little more charring would've really help to lift it further. Also not sure what were the toppings on the tomato halves, but we didnt think they were necessary.

The only saving grace was the service and the complimentary home made fruity liquor. Then again it was a Monday night and it wasn't busy at all.
We have been regular visitors of the shop and always enjoy dining experience here. Attentive service, delicious food, cozy atmosphere. Couldnt ask for more ðŸ’•
A gem in Vung Tau. Absolutely one of the best restaurants I visited there. Pricey but deserves a try.

Have more beautiful salads and seperate sauces. I like duck breast because the sauce is special. So yummy. With desert menu, cream brulee is good but I like chocolate cake more
Love all ^^
Great place. Prices are light high but quality of food is respective. Shrimps are 180.000 mango and shrimps salad is 140.000. Big portions and awasome drinks. Nice people there))
Nice fancy place with lots of options, Italian, Spanish, French. Salad was good, carbonara was even better. Pork belly lacked flavor and balance. Icecream made up for that.

I came here for lunch and ordered the ravioli with a glass of the house white, followed by creme brulee and coffee. I was annoyed when they then brought me a glass of house red, after I said several times "tráº¯ng". The wine was okay but nothing special.  The ravioli was again okay but a bit flavourless. The creme brulee was delicious. Overall a good experience, but can I politely suggest upgrading your whisky selection to some nice single malts. Also, this is the first French restaurant I have attended where I did not receive fresh bread on the table.
Enjoyed my food and drinks .. splendid .. staff good service and friendly with me .. got everything I wanted and more .. recommended Malbec Argentina wine ..
Lovely french restaurant. The John Dory was excellent and the desert also tickled us the right way. Very much recommended if you want something a bit different I'm Vung Tau.

Excellent, international quality food at a reasonable price. Had an assortment of appies including patas bravas, shrimp and mango salad and tuna tartar. Started off with a home brewed passion fruit shooter that was delicious and finished off with some mango passion fruit cheescake. Which was to die for. Will be back soon to try the seafood paella for two before leaving Vung Tau.

I loved my experience at this restaurant! The food was delicious, and the waitress was lovely, attentive, and professional. I highly recommend this place for great cuisine and warm service. Iâ€™ll definitely be back!

French owner. Spanish name !
Good selection of European favourites.
Seating upstairs is nicer.

Excellent spot for European cuisine , particularly French!
Good wine pairing and amazing crepes as dessert!
I only questioned the texture of bread side dish. Except that, I liked the dishes what I ordered, especially the flavor of mushroom. If I were in Vung Tau, no doubt that I would be visit here again.

Not many vegetarian dishes. But I got something like vegetable casserole as starter (cold) and added fried mushrooms - was very good. One of rare places here to find a good dessert. Creme brulee and chocolate fondant (lava cake) was excellent.

Best meal in our trip to Vung Tau!!!

Every dish was made with love and passion. The chief also makes wine from fruits and offered 01 free glass to every customer (5 colorful glasses in the pix). They taste amazing.

Thanks so much for letting us have a relaxing and delicious lunch.
I had a good lunch. Price is ok, not so expensive, a bit higher than average.

Decent Western food. Hi prices for local. Spanish oriented dishes, but has other international ones as well.
Well trained service staffs.

Ate here with my Girlfriend and friend while on our trip through Vung Tau, we tried the meter of Rum which was amazing, we also each loved our dishes and the appetizers, everything we had was delicious, the bowl of olives alone would of made me want to give Don Duijote's 5 stars, but the Calimari was also amazing, I personally don't like Calimari because it's chewy and I'm not a big seafood guy but theirs was done so perfect even I as well as my girlfriend and friend enjoyed it. I will be returning and I hope they get all the business possible. By far the best meal I've had in Vung Tau, maybe even Vietnam in a whole.

Was a frequent customer but I guess not anymore, their new menu is a downgrade, more expensive, worse food. We had shrimp and mango salad (didn't notice about the passion fruit sauce), the problem with this dish is none of the ingredients work with each other, and the overly sweet sauce makes the dish even more unbearable. I would recommend the goat cheese salad instead.
Our 2nd dish was lamb bbq, before it was lamb chops, now it's a chunk of boring meat which is almost 600k, I would have ordered steak if I want that much meat. We weren't that fulfilling in the end but decided to get the bill and just left for dessert in another place. It's disappointing and sad at the same time how I used to hang out with friends here so many times.

Update after having a heart to heart talk with the store employee or manager: they gave me an apology then started making excuses then demand that I should take the review off google map ðŸ™‚ yeah nah

As a Vegan I ordered Patatas Bravas (fried potatoes), plate of mushrooms and sautÃ©ed vegetables, with a couple of baskets of bread. The food was insanely delicious and made a nice change from Asian cuisine. Friends there are also loving there food every time.
High price efficiency restaurant. Good tasty and good price. Clean and calm. But table is small. So, feel uncomfortable for more than 6 people together.

This us not the first time I came for first time was last year and now back in Vietnam for second time and of course return to Don Quijote steakhouse .. the employee even the owner are very abs very friendly and lot of foreigners came to eat there .. the food they had was one of the best .. I would recommend for anyone to go there I keep came back for 3 days straight .. but I definitely will be back when I come back again to Vietnam

The food was amazing, and the staff were very friendly and attentive.
I highly recommend. â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

After nearly two months in Vung Tau, I have to say this is one of our favorite restaurants in town. The service is at the very top of any of the restaurants we've visited. The food menu is inventive, flavorful, and high quality. And the atmosphere is very comfortable, clean, and inviting.

Maybe the best western food restaurant in Vung Tau.
Dessert is also delicious.
Tasty food, however too little for the price. Nice and very friendly staff

A little gem of a restaurant, food is outstanding. I've been in VT only a few days and ate here on more than one occasion.

Everything I've eaten has been of a quality I would expect at a high end establishment.

Burger was cooked to medium perfection, the fries reminded me of the chips my Mother made.

The starter of shrimps with garlic and chorizo with bread are delicious, juicy, tasty and the bread to soak up all the flavours hmmmm.

I've also eaten the foie gras ravioli with butternut that also came with bread.

Tonight I ate the shrimp starter again and the seafood linguine was delicious.

I'm a Scotsman, there's not many things that would make my hackles rise and even the owners mistake of thinking I was English when we spoke is a sin that was quickly forgiven and forgotten.

I'll be back to sample more of this small but taste bud teasing menu.

Wonderful meals and service with a smile. Lovely ambience. Great evening
Thank you.

Good vibe,
But I donâ€™t really feel the French cuisine, the quality is just average, the lamb and duck were dry and not juicy
Very impressed by the food, nice atmosphere and staff too
Good vibe, nice food, a western cuisine restaurant in Vung Tau you should try.
the seating arrangement could be improved. but the food is consistently well-made.
Closest I could get to authentic French cuisine in the middle of Vungtau :) super friendly staff as well!
Amazing food. Hope to come here again soon.

It was a last minute decision to eat here, but such a good one. We sat upstairs on the patio, where 2 staff were present at all times to look after the customers. The service was fantastic, the food incredible (you must try dessert, no matter what), and the price very reasonable for what you get/quality of the food.
